loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O Sr. Armando de 39 anos de idade, casado e tem 6 filhos de idade dos quais 1 è independente vive na sua propria casa, 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e os 2 sao menores de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele e negociante vende produtos da 1ª necessidade na sua propria casa, actividade que esta ser  acompanhada juntamente com a sua esposa a mais de 10 anos, alem de ser  negociante de produtos da 1ª necessidade è pescador, vende peixe a retail nos mercados de Boane e Maputo.
O presente emprestimo sera apliacdo para comprar prudutos da 1ª necessidade: feijao, oleo, amendoim, omo, ferinha de milho, frangos e acucar para aumentar o volume do seu negocio na sua casa.
texts.en:
Armando, 39 years old, is married and has six children: one adult who lives in his own home, three who are in elementary school, and two who are not yet of school age. He has had a business selling staple goods from his home for more than 10 years, and his wife helps him with the business. In addition to selling staple goods, he is a fisherman and sells fish in the markets of Boane and Maputo.
He will use this loan to buy staple goods—beans, cooking oil, peanuts, eggs, corn meal, chickens, and sugar—to increase the stock he carries in his home business.

loans.use: to buy staple goods—beans, cooking oil, peanuts, eggs, corn meal, chickens, and sugar—to increase the stock he carries in his home business.

loans.name: Maria Danelia

texts.es: María Danelia de 51 años de edad casada con tres hijos mayores de edad, reside en uno de los municipios del departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país es propietaria y administradora varios negocios los  cual consiste en: destace de cerdo, venta de pollo y productos de consumo masivo como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, golosinas, pan, verduras, detergentes entre otros, también  comercializa con productos lácteos donde ofrece deliciosas cuajadas, cremas, boronas, leche agria, María Danelia  desde hace ya más de 19 que ella tiene este negocio los cuales realiza sus compras en distribuidoras además ella vende los cerdos ya destazados  todos los fines de semanas al igual que sus deliciosos nacatamales donde ella es muy reconocida . Uno de sus sueños es poder lograr una buena educación para su pequeña nieta y poder tener mejores ingresos, el objetivo de este crédito es para la invertir en capital de trabajo principalmente en pollo al por mayor.
texts.en: Maria Danelia is 51, married and has 3 grown children. She lives in a community in the department of Chinandega in the western part of the country. She is the owner and administrator of several business which include: cutting up pork, sales of chicken and mass consumption products like rice, sugar, beans, oil, candy, bread, vegetables, detergents, etc. She also sells milk products and offers delicious curds, cheese, boronas [a type of bread], and sour milk [a milk product similar to buttermilk]. Maria Daniela has had this business for more than 19 years and makes her purchases from distributors. In addition, on weekends she sells pork that is already cut up as well as her delicious nacatamales, for which she is well-known. One of her dreams is to enable her little granddaughter to get a good education and to be able to have a higher income. The objective of this loan is to invest it in working capital, principally in wholesale chicken.

loans.use: to buy various products for her businesses, principally to purchase chicken

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.pt:
O Sr. Carlos de 36 anos de idade, casado e tem 3 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario, 1 e menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ele e negociante a mais de 10 anos vende produtos da 1ª necessidades, uma actividade que esta a ser acompanhado junto com sua esposa na sua casa.
O presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade: omo, oleo, massa, arroz, pihas, caldo, farinha de milho, para aumentar o volume do seu negocio na sua casa, tem como esperanca futuramente melhorar as condicoes de habitacao e a dieta almentar da sua familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 36 years old, is married and has three children, two of whom are in elementary school and one of whom is not yet of school age. He has had a business selling staple goods out of his house for more than ten years, and his wife helps him with the business.
He will use this loan to buy staple goods—eggs, cooking oil, pasta, rice, stock, and corn meal—to increase the stock he carries in his home business. His hope for the future is to improve his family's living conditions and offer them a better diet.

loans.use: to buy staple goods—eggs, cooking oil, pasta, rice, stock, and corn meal—to increase the stock he carries in his home business.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married with 3 children. She is 58 years old and lives in San Jose Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur. She runs a sari-sari store to earn a living, selling items like canned goods, bread, soap, coffee, etc. She has had this business for 4 years. Each month she earns about PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to pay for more canned goods, soap, bread, coffee, shampoo, etc. for her sari-sari store. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future Evangeline hopes to become a successful business woman and to expand her business in order to give education to her children.

loans.use: To pay for more canned goods, soap, bread, coffee, shampoo, etc.

location.town: Molave - San Jose Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary Lourdes

texts.en:
Mary Lourdes is 42 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. She works in the fish industry and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 6 years. 

She has requested a loan to pay for fishing supplies. She has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Mary Lourdes hopes to have more savings for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for fishing supplies.

loans.name: Jenelin

texts.en:
Jenelin is married with no children. She is 31 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela, Philippines.

Jenelin is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feed and other veterinary supplies.

Jenelin has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and other veterinary supplies

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato is 47 years old and lives in Candanay Sur, Siquijor, Siquijor. He is married with three children who are all adults.

Renato is engaged in the peanut processing business to earn a living and has had this activity for almost 21 years. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 30,000. He has requested a loan amounting to PHP 50,000 to be used to purchase additional equipment for peanut processing. 

He has been a member of PMPC for almost one year and shows a good credit record. In the future, he hopes to expand his business with this institution.

loans.use: To  buy additional equipment for peanut processing

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: Jader es originario de la ciudad de Boaco y tiene 23 años de edad. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol. Comenzo trabajando con su padre, desde muy pequeño, lo cual fue de mucha ayuda  para adquirir experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo  de su familia quienes comercializan la cosecha. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Abono, insecticida, urea y fertilizantes ya que necesita estos productos para curar su cultivo. Su meta futuro es comprar manzanas de tierra y expandir su cosecha, logrando adquirir mayores ingresos. Su plan próximo es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en: Jader is from the city of Boaco and he’s 23 years old.  He is a farmer who raises corn and beans and began working with his father when he was very young, which was very helpful for him in gaining experience.  He has his family’s support and they begin the harvest.  He is asking for this loan so he can buy compost, insecticide, urea, and fertilizers for his crops.  His goal for the future is to buy more land to expand his harvest so he can increase his income.  His next plan is to improve the infrastructure in his home..

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Nusratullo

texts.ru: Нусратулло профессиональный мастер из города Вахдат. Ему 46 лет. У него среднее техническое образование. Нусратулло занимается ремонтом техники в своей мастерской. Он из тех людей, которые живут по честному и ведут законный образ жизни. У него есть семья - жена и двое детей. Его сыну 11 лет, а дочке 7 лет. Его дети школьники, а жена занимается швейным делом. Нусратулло работает мастером по ремонту техники в течение 13 лет. Он ремонтирует телевизоры, DVD, радиоприемники и другую разную технику. Он очень опытен в своей работе и быстро справляется с починкой техники. Сейчас Нусратулло нуждается в кредите, чтобы продвигать деятельность. Он просит кредит для приобретения необходимых запчастей для ремонта техники.
texts.en: Nusratullo is a professional repairman from the city of Vahdat.  He is 46 years old.  He has secondary technical education.  Nusratullo repairs electrical appliances in his workshop.  He is one of those people who live their lives honestly and abide by the law.  He is married and has two children.  His son is 11 years old and his daughter is seven.  His kids attend school and his wife works as a seamstress.  Nusratullo has been repairing appliances for 13 years.  He repairs televisions, DVD players, radios and other sundry electronics.  Currently, Nusratullo is in need of a loan to move his business forward.  He is asking for a loan to purchase critical parts to repair appliances.

loans.use: To purchase parts for the repair of electronics.

loans.name: Manuel Santana

texts.es:
Manuel de 42 años de edad, se dedica desde muy pequeño a trabajar en la agricultura y en la crianza de ganado sus padres le inculcaron a desempeñar esta actividad  siendo una familia bastante numerosa de 14 miembros y de escasos recursos económicos, no pudieron darles a todos la oportunidad de estudiar por la misma situación. A sus 20 años se acompaño y empezó a trabajar por su cuenta en compañía de su compañera de vida, de esta unión tuvieron 4 hijos dos de ellos ya se acompañaron y se fueron del hogar y sus otros dos están estudiando un bachillerato.

Junto a sus padres y hermanos cultivaban 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ademas trabajaban en la algodonera cultivando propio y trabajando como jornal. Hoy en día trabaja 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y también hace viajes en carreta cuando esta es solicitada y como jornal. Los que le ayudan son sus dos hijos mayores con quienes trabaja en diferentes áreas de tierra ya que los menores están estudiando.

Los fondos del crédito serán utilizados para la compra de insumos agrícolas, como: abonos, fertilizantes, pago de mosos y para preparar la tierra para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz. Se espera favorecer mejor el cultivo de maíz y lograr tener al final de la cosecha una mayor producción. Manifiesta, que en un futuro desea construir una vivienda de ladrillo y siempre seguir trabajando la agricultura y con las ganancias que genera adquirir bovinos; ademas, brindarles el estudio a sus hijos si es posible hasta un grado superior.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old and has made a living by working in agriculture and raising cattle from the time he was very young. His parents taught him to perform these activities, as he is from a rather large family with 14 members and scarce financial resources. For this same reason, they were not able to give everyone the opportunity to study. At the age of twenty, he got together with his life partner; they began to work on their own and had four children together. Two of his children are already in relationships and have left home, while the other two are studying for their high school degrees.

Together with his parents and siblings, he cultivated 14,000 square meters of corn and also worked with cotton, cultivating his own and working as a day laborer. He currently works on 14,000 square meters of corn and also makes trips in a cart when he is requested and as a day laborer. He is helped by his two older children, who work on different areas of the land, as the two younger ones are studying.

The funds from the loan will be utilized to buy agricultural supplies like manure and fertilizers, to pay workers and to prepare the land to plant 14,000 square meters of corn. He hopes to improve his cultivation of corn and to be able to have a better production at the end of the harvest. He says that in the future he wants to build a brick house and to always keep working in agriculture. With his earnings he wants to buy cattle and also provide his children with the opportunity to study at a higher level, if possible.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers, to pay workers and to prepare the land to plant 14,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en: Kefa is a conservative woman, so she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Kefa was born in 1971. She is married and has six daughters and two sons. Her husband has been working in dairy products sales for seven years. He owns a piece of land and started his project by creating a farm on this land. Her husband is planning to increase the milk production of the dairy, expand his farm and increase the number of cows in the future. Now Kefa is asking for a loan to buy barley for the cows, which will help to increase their productivity.

loans.use: To buy barley for the cows

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is living with her husband, 2 daughters and 3 sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has been making shoes since 1998. His practice is to take orders and provide services for making shoes. The contractors provide raw materials to her husband and her husband provides only services for making shoes. Time to time he has gotten lots of market experience, and he has made good relationships in the market. Now that he knows how to tackle the customers and about the market rates very well, he realized that he is not getting the proper reward for his services.
He decided to start his own business so that he could get maximum reward for his efforts. For this purpose Asia requested a loan so that her husband could buy raw materials and could start his shoe business.
Asia hopes that now her husband will be able to sell his hand made shoes and he will succeed to convince the clients. In this way his sale will increase, and his family will have a good chance for survival with better living standard.

loans.use: to buy material for making shoes to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is 58 years old and a widowed woman. She is a mother of two sons. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health care. She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with stitching techniques and enjoys a great client list.

To cope with the orders of her customers on time, she requested a loan of Rs 15,000. She will use the loan to buy a stock of thread in various colors, along with packs of buttons and needles. Then, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers, without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in various colors, along with packs of buttons and needles

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is from a beautiful city in Pakistan. She is the age of 42, she has a life partner, mother of 6 children, one school-aged child and one of whom goes with his father over building material and sheltering shop. Kubra is a friendly, hard-working, and honorable person, which she has shown through her six previous loans with BRAC. These loans have imposed a major impact on her family because they have helped her to improve the business. Her husband owns a construction materials shop in which he sells cement, bricks, sand, concrete and provides sheltering services also. 

Therefore, she requested a loan for her husband, he will use this new loan to buy sheltering materials because they became damaged and useless. She would like to say thank to Kiva for this support since it is enabling her to improve her home.

loans.use: To buy sheltering material such as wooden pillars and boards.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam, is a 36-year-old married woman, who lives with her husband and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has a business providing passenger transportation services in his auto rickshaw. Her husband has been doing this work for about eight years. To carry out his work, he gets up very early because he has to look for passengers on the streets of his city.

Her husband enjoys his work because he can manage his free time and have more time to spend with his family. In addition, he is able to obtain very good earnings. Now her husband feels tranquil and comfortable, because he has a regular income and has more free time. This will be her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes that with your cooperation, her husband will be able to carry out his plans. She promises to make payments on time.

Maryam requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy the body of an auto rickshaw.  Maryam is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for this honor.

loans.use: To buy the body of auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 42-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband makes iron chains by hand in his workshop. The chain is made on a hearth by hammering cut lengths of red hot wrought iron rods into oval links, one link passing through the next to form a cable. Now, the price of iron has increased and he does not have any in stock to make more chains so he is unable to make any chains to sell and earn an income.

Nagina requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy new iron rod coils and start his business again. Nagina is the mother of six children and it is very difficult to feed all of them in a day. Her dreams are to provide all the necessities to each of her children. Nagina is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan for this honorable favor.

loans.use: To buy new iron rod coils to make chains to sell.

loans.name: Khatoon

texts.en:
Khatoon from Pakistan! This is 24-year from Lahore. She is married and has 5 children. Her last born attends primary school and is in 3rd standard, remaining children are too young and fully dependent upon their parents. 
Her husband runs a wooden stall shop in which he sells pieces of woods to chefs for wedding ceremonies food. The business has been in operation for almost 10 years but suddenly the rates of woods have increased and he does not have enough savings to buy new inventory to sell. 
Khatoon has requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, in order to buy wooden pieces to sell. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her more disposable income to buy food and pay rent and fees for the child in school.

loans.use: to buy wooden pieces for resale

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is a member of a two-person lending group and she lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four daughters and two sons. Her husband is a government employee. Asia herself has been running a clothing business for the past two years. 

She purchases clothes from different areas of Pakistan and sells them in the main market at a profitable price. The income generated from her clothing business plays a very important role in the family's needs. Presently, she needs to purchase a variety of clothes to sell in the market. She does not have enough savings to purchase them, so she has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. She dreams to provide all the facilities to her children. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to sell in the market

loans.name: Hilda Soledad

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda es socia del grupo de crédito Las Triunfadoras. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que resplandece por su belleza arquitectónica y natural, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, se encuentra  bañada por 4 ríos, goza de una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

La Señora. Hilda tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos mayores de edad, tres de sus hijos ya son casados y viven independientes, sus tres hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo labora vendiendo billetes de lotería, la casa en la que viven es arrendada.

Doña Hilda tiene bazar y bisutería desde hace 5 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, también se dedica a la preparación y venta de almuerzos. Estas dos actividades le han ayudado a sacar adelante a su familia.

El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de artículos de bazar y bisutería. 

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the communal bank Las Triunfadoras (The Winners) and lives in Cuenca. The city, known for its architectural and natural beauty, was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999. Four rivers flow through the area, which also offers great culinary variety.

Hilda, 50, is married and has six grown children, three of whom are married and living independently and three who are working and helping her financially. Her husband sells lottery tickets, and they live in a rented house. Hilda has operated a household goods and costume jewelry shop for five years. She works every day on a flexible schedule, and she also prepares and sells lunches. The two activities have helped her provide for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy household goods and costume jewelry. Her goal is to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy household goods and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es:
Eulalio  es un hombre soltero de 58 años de edad, tiene dos hijos quienes viven en el Caserío Chuicacaste, Aldea Pixabaj, Sololá, Sololá.
El se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas de diferentes tipos como zanahoria, papa y maíz a unos metros de donde vive.
Esta actividad  lo aprendió junto a su padre cuando era pequeño y gracias a sus enseñanzas ahora cuenta con 35 años de realizar esta actividad, en donde obtiene la mayor parte de sus ingresos y ganancias. El es un hombre que lucha por salir adelante junto a su familia y es por ello que aun se encuentra laborando.
El se ha dado cuenta que existe una fuerte demanda en su producción ya que cada vez va en aumento, de modo que el solicita un préstamo de Q  5,000.00 para la compra de fertilizante químico para el cultivo de maíz.
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su cultivo para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Eulalio is a 58-year-old single man. He has two children who live in the Chuicacaste hamlet, Pixabaj village, Sololá, Sololá. He makes a living by growing different types of vegetables a few meters from where he lives, such as carrots, potatoes and corn. He learned this activity from his father when he was young, and thanks to his father's teachings he has now been doing this work for 35 years. He obtains the greater part of his income and earnings from this work.

Eulalio is a man who strives to get ahead with his family and this is why he is still working. He has realized that there is a strong and constantly increasing demand for his production, so he is asking for a loan of 5,000.00 Guatemalan quetzales to buy chemical fertilizer for the cultivation of corn.

His greatest dream is to expand his cultivation in order to improve the conditions of his home.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for the cultivation of corn

loans.name: Tanveer

texts.en:
Tanveer is a 30-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible son; his parents like him a lot due to his care. Tanveer has owned a dairy farm in his town since 1993. Ali gets milk from buffalo two times a day, which is very hard work for a single person.  A few days ago one of his cattle suddenly died due to a fatal disease. Also, his cowshed cracked, has water leaks on rainy days, and needs maintenance. These damages are highly affecting his sales. 

Tanveer wants to buy a buffalo and maintain his cowshed but he has insufficient savings. He requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that he could overcome these deficiencies and continue his business smoothly. From his profits, Tanveer would like to start his own livestock breeding business, since he has now acquired sufficient experience in this business. He wants to hire an assistant to help him in his daily tasks. Tanveer is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for getting milk to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mistica está en su ciclo número tres del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una, no solo en lo económico, sino también en su aspecto general, donde tres integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con bajos ingresos.
Una persona digna de destacar es la Sra. Elena, quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales (remedios  yuyos). Comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pero que está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto con el que está sacando adelante a su familia. Hoy ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para poder seguir trabajando y dando a sus clientes buenos productos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Rosa Mistica (Mystical Rose) is in its third loan cycle with the women's program. The members are participating in the poverty reduction survey to determine their financial and overall situations; three of the members are living below the poverty line, that is, at very low income levels.

It is worth highlighting Elena, one of the members, who sells natural medicines. She says the work is demanding, but she is proud of what she does because it is dignified and honest work that lets her provide for her family. She has applied for this loan to buy natural medicines so that she can keep working and offering her customers good products.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Ayat Group

texts.en: There are four women members of the group, "Ayat". They live in Sana`a, Yemen. Amah is the leader of group and has a tailoring business. She is a 42-year-old.   She started her business at home. While running the business is difficult, she has been able to make a sufficient profit which has helped her take care of her needs and the needs of her family. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) to buy fabrics and sewing materials for her business. She hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Saeed Group

texts.en:
This group is called Saeed and consists of three women and two men. They live in Taiz, Yemen. This community is hardworking and works as much as they can in order to have better living conditions. 

They took out a loan of 250,000 Yemeni Rials (YER). Simon is the leader of the group. She is a married woman, and she is 37 years old. She has a small house. She went through a lot of effort and had to save money with her husband to set up her house. She is aiming to renovate her house. She took out a loan of 50,000 YER to buy construction supplies to renovate her house. She hopes with this loan to live a good life with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate her  house.

loans.name: Ijaz

texts.en:
Ijaz is 50 years old and a hardworking and honest man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. He owns an electric  and sanitation goods shop which is the only source of income for his family. He sell a variety of electrical and sanitation goods in his shop, like sanitation pipes, generators, bulbs, electric wires, nuts, etc. He wants to purchase some important electric wires and pipes to sell. For that he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. 

His biggest dream is provide higher education to his children. His wife is very caring and responsible lady. He has a great family. He loves his family and he wants to provide all facilities to his family.

loans.use: To purchase electrical wires and pipes to sell.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades, pero también hacen actividades juntas para poder fomentar su compañerismo. Este comité se encuentra en su 6 ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tiene cada una de las integrantes.
Maria es manicurista y una muy buena, es muy conocida por ser excelente manicurista, y gracias a eso ya se hizo de muy buena clientela. Su sueño es poder tener su salón y poder trabajar ahí. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de esmaltes, limas, alicates y demás, y así seguir trabajando y luchando por mejorar su economía y la de su familia. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo, que le permitirá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The members of this communal bank engage in a variety of activities and also work together to foster their camaraderie. The group is in its sixth loan cycle, and each member's sense of responsibility and desire to succeed is noteworthy.

Maria is an excellent and well-regarded manicurist, who has established a good client base. She dreams of working at her own salon. She has applied for this loan to buy varnish, files, pliers, and more so that she can keep working and striving to improve her and her family's financial situation. She is grateful for this opportunity, which will let her keep growing her business.

loans.use: to buy varnish, files, pliers, and more.

loans.name: Evelin Arely

texts.es: Doña  Evelyn  de 30 años de edad  vive en casa de un familiar con sus padres,  su esposo y su hijo  de 1 mes de nacido,  desde hace varios años posee un salón de belleza en su lugar de residencia, el cual le ha generado su salario y con el cual ella solventa algunos de los gastos de la casa, doña Evelyn esta solicitando un crédito con el cual piensa realizar la compra de implementos  y accesorios para su salón de belleza como cremas, tintes y ganchos  para el cabello, shampoo, etc.   y así generar  mayores ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Evelyn is 30 years old and lives with her parents, her husband, and a one month old son.  She has had a beauty salon in her home for a number of years, which has generated her income with which he pays some of her household expenses.  Evelyn is asking for this loan to buy implements and accessories, such as creams, tints, and hair clips, shampoo, etc. for her salon.  This way she can generate more income and be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 22-year-old Lebanese man who is single. He has been working in the construction field for more than eight years. He got involved in this type of business at a very young age in order to get extra financial support for the family.  

Today, Hasan is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase construction equipment and, specifically, an electrical winch so  his work can proceed as it should. Hasan has a part-timer helping him with the work. He plans to hire him as a full-timer at his earliest convenience as he has no doubt that he will achieve a significant expansion in his business and increase its capital after receiving the loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction equipment and specifically an electrical winch

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo número  dos del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas están empezando a trabajar juntas y se ayudan las unas a las otras. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde dos integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, pero siguen trabajando por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Selva quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno. Ella cuenta con un copetín, en el que trabaja desde muy tempranas horas todos los días, es una persona muy sacrificada que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante y luchando.
La Sra. Selva. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de azúcar, aceite, yerba, panificados, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) is in its second loan cycle with the women's program. The women are working together and helping each other. They are participating in the poverty elimination survey, in which two of the members are shown to be living below the poverty line, that is, with very low incomes, though they are working to improve their situations.

Selva, one of the members, was living at level one in the last poverty survey. She has a snack shop, where she works from early morning every day. She is dedicated and has been making progress through hard work and sacrifice. Selva has applied for a loan to buy sugar, oil, herbs, and breads that will help her put her business plan into action and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, herbs, breads, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old, and a widow with four children. She lives in Balangasan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Rebecca sells goods and dry goods, just to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. Rebecca has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to build a bigger store for her products.

loans.use: to buy more goods and dry goods to sell at her store

location.town: Pagadian - Balangasan District, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is married with one child who is in school. Mary Jane is 36 years old and lives in Cantaroc-A, Maria, Siquijor.
Mary Jane has been engaged in poultry business to earn a living for almost three months. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5,000.

She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to be used for purchasing additional feeds and chickens. 
She is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and chickens.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nueva Esperanza está en su ciclo 20 del programa de comité, ellas hace varios ciclos que vienen esforzándose por mejorar e ir creciendo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, luchadoras. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que mostró que todas han crecido bastante.
La señora Olinda, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa se encuentra mejorando su vida y la de su familia. Ella tiene una despensa en su casa, que con esfuerzo ha ido mejorando y manteniendo, y gracias a ello da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para poder seguir creciendo. Hoy solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de yerba, arroz, panificados, bebidas, y demás insumos y así seguir dando a sus clientes lo que necesitan, y también poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) is in its 20th loan cycle with the women's program. The women have participated in these loan cycles so that they could work hard to improve and grow. The women head their households and are fighters. The poverty elimination program shows that they have improved their situation substantially.

Olinda, though continued effort and behavior suitable to a successful woman, has improved her and her family's standard of living. She has a shop in her house, which she strives to maintain and improve, that provides everything her family needs to keep going. She has applied for a loan to buy herbs, rice, breads, beverages, and other merchandise to be able to meet her customers' needs and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy herbs, rice, breads, beverages, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Richel

texts.en:
Richel is 29 years old and married. She has one child. She lives in Dao Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Richel makes assorted bags to sell, just to earn a living. She earns approximately PHP 10,000 earch month. She requested a loan, which she will use for additional capital, to buy more raw materials for the bags.

Richel has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future she wants to buy more machines to use in making the bags.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for making bags

location.town: PAgadian - Dao, Pagadian City Zamboanga del sur

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 25 years old and lives in Camanga, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has two children.

Marites has a shop that is a sari-sari (variety store). She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more inventory for her store, like soft drinks, canned goods, and other things.

Marites has been a memmber of PMPC for four years. Marites hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Francisco se formo con la unión de mujeres muy trabajadoras, que con el anhelo de dar a sus familias un futuro mejor, quieren seguir luchando. Hace 7 ciclos que trabajando juntas y quieren poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día.
Una persona digna de destacar es Yenny, quien es una persona muy trabajadora, que con gran esfuerzo pudo hacerse de un pequeño negocio para poder brindar a su familia lo mínimo que necesitan y que no les falte el pan de cada día. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y es con eso que está teniendo los ingresos para poder dar a su familia lo que necesita.
Ella pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de perfumes y fragancias, que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, invertir en mas productos y seguir trabajando y luchando.
texts.en:
The 'San Francisco' group was formed by very hard-working women who want to keep striving with the desire to give their families a better future. They have been working together for seven cycles and want to keep growing and improving each day.

A member worth highlighting is Yenny, who is a very hard-working person. With great effort she was able to start a small business to be able to provide her family with the minimum it needs and to ensure that they aren't lacking their daily bread. She makes a living from selling perfumes; from this work she earns an income to be able to give her family what it needs.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying perfumes and fragrances, which will allow her to continue with her sales, invest in more products and keep working and striving.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and fragrances to sell

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en:
Agapita is married and has four children. She is 53 years old. She lives in Estrella, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Agapita has a store, where she sells a variety of products to earn a living. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns PHP 1500 doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900. She will use the loan to purchase additional products to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, candies, junk foods, beverages, detergents and soaps.

Agapita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  Agapita hope to save money for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell at her store, such as canned goods, noodles, and soaps

loans.name: Fiko

texts.en:
Fiko is an Egyptian who lives in southeastern Albania. She needs to repair a leaky ceiling immediately before the heavy rains start.

Fiko explained: “All the water comes in, and we have to use buckets so that the water doesn’t spread inside. This is the first time that I am applying for a loan, and in reality, I was not aware of any loans for unbanked people like myself that existed.  And I have to thank the loan officer who passed by my home and asked me if I was in need of any money. He was a godsend.” Fiko smiled as she spoke, contending that finally her money issue was about to be solved.

She needs a loan of 150,000 Albanian lek (ALL).

loans.use: to repair her leaky ceiling and make some other home repairs

loans.name: Bardhok

texts.en:
Bardhok wants to buy a dairy cow with the loan that he is requesting from Kiva lenders. He wants to sell milk and baby calves to the locals. He said: “I have seen others in my village and region that pursue livestock activity, and they comment that it is worthwhile.  Up until now, I have been selling fresh veggies and fruits and sometimes eggs, but adding some dairy produce will boost my income eventually and of course will increase the work volume, but I am ready for it. Livestock requires more hard labor because you have to wake up very early to milk the animals and get them out of the stable to breathe a bit of the morning fresh air, but anyhow almost every villager is an early riser whether they wanted or not."

Bardok has four children, all school-aged, and they live in the very rural northern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 61 years old and lives in Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga del Sur. She is widowed and has one child.

Erlinda has a shop, where she sells produce, like mangoes, bananas, and tomatoes. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan to use for buying additional produce to sell.

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for four years. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy produce to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Anonang, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Filomon

texts.es: El señor Filomon, es una persona de 30 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, pero actualmente vive en concubinato, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con dos dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus pequeños hijos, vive en su propio domicilio de tipo rustico, construido con material local, que se halla situado en la localidad de Tíraque, la actividad principal del señor Filomon es la agricultura, de tal forma produce anualmente papa 100 cargas, trigo (grano) 16 quintales, cebada (grano) 4 cargas y finalmente 40 calchas de avena (forraje) los productos son cultivados en sus propios terrenos y  alguna vez en los terrenos de sus padres, los terrenos mencionados se encuentran en la misma localidad, por lo cual el señor Filomon se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para compra de insumos agrícolas, en el futuro con la producción incrementara sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Filomon is 30 years old and unmarried, but lives with his partner. He was able to complete primary school education. He has two children to support financially. He lives in his own house, which is very basic and constructed with local materials, and located in the Tíraque region. 

Filomon's primary job is farming; annually, he produces 100 cargas (a regional unit of dry measure) of potatoes, about 1600 pounds of wheat, 4 cargas of barley, and 40 bushels of oats (fodder). He grows the products on his own land, and sometimes on his parents' land, which is in the same region. 

Filomon is asking for operating capital to buy farming supplies. In the future, with higher production, he will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, married, with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 3,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

Gloria has been raising pigs for six years and earns additional income from coconut vending.

Gloria is working tirelessly toward the attainment of he dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Jeta

texts.en:
Jeta is a villager who lives in rural southeastern Albania. For almost eight years, she has been selling fresh agricultural produce such as grains, lots of potatoes, red onions, and of course other veggies to the local market of the nearby city. Now she wants to buy a milk cow with the help of lenders from Kiva.

This will be her first loan, and she is very grateful to Kiva for providing the opportunity to get a startup loan, which enables people at her financial level to establish rural business or other types of activities.

Jeta is 53 and a mother of two children, who are both continuing their education.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Lorie

texts.en:
Lorie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from selling vegetables.

Lorie is borrowing 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more stock of frozen products such as chicken, hot dogs, and meat to resell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of frozen products such as chicken, hot dogs, and meat for resale

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Marife is borrowing 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling food. She is borrowing 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pig-fattening business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through a prior loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita, a 59-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. For seven years she has been running a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Having received and repaid 15 previous loans from NWTF, Melita is requesting a new one for PHP 4000 to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, egg, noodles, soap, etc. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, egg, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 53-year-old married woman. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children.

Haleema has taken this loan for her daughter. She is making handmade embroidery at her home. 

Haleema belongs to a poor family and each member is making an effort to earn money. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw and earns a small amount. He earns very low wages which are insufficient to meet the daily household expenses. Her daughter has proved herself a brave woman and does not become a burden to her parents. She showed herself independent and earns a sufficient income through embroidery. 

Haleema requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stock of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Her daughter does not want lose her heart and wants to be able to afford all the household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family.
Haleema is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors for embroidery.

loans.name: Al Hayat 1 Group

texts.en:
Nariman is the featured borrower of the Al Hayat 1 Group; she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, and has always been neighbors and friends with the other group members.

Nariman has been employed in a beauty salon for ten years, with a special expertise in women's facial beauty treatments.

She is a 28-year-old married mother of two. She has very good experience in her domain; that's why she is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a special facial beauty machine, which is very important for improving her own developed business. It will improve both her business and family situation.

Nariman is the first from the left wearing blue. As for the other members, Joumana is wearing black, Suzan is wearing blue and standing second from the right, and Suzane is wearing a white shirt.

loans.use: To buy a special facial beauty machine

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora, es una señora que vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba,  está casada y tiene 3 hijos. Desde muy joven Flora trabajo muy duro para lograr construir su casa y tener dinero para comprar vacas, actualmente cuenta con vacas que producen leche todos los días y Flora es quien les da su alimento. Todos los días se despierta a las 4:30 de la mañana para comenzar su trabajo hasta cerca del mediodía, después descansa hasta las 3 de la tarde para seguir atendiendo a las vacas, su trabajo es agotador pero ella lo hace para sacar adelante a su familia. Flora solicita el crédito para comprar cascara de soya para alimentar a las vacas, ya que actualmente es la época de invierno y no existe alimento fresco, por tanto debe comprar alimento seco para que el ganado se pueda alimentar y así seguir produciendo leche que le genera ingresos a Flora  y de esta manera podrá mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Flora is married and has 3 children; she lives in the city of Cochabamba. From a young age, Flora has worked very hard in order to build their home and earn money to buy cows. Now she has cows that produce milk every day. Every day she feeds them, waking up at 4:30 in the morning, working until around noon, then resting until 3 in the afternoon to continue taking care of the cows. The work is exhausting but she does it to raise her family.

Flora is requesting a loan to buy soybean husks to feed the cows, as it is currently winter and there is no fresh food. She must buy dry feed for the livestock so they can keep producing the milk that provides Flora's income and in this manner, improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy soybean husks.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market where he has maintained many contacts for years. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She expects to boost her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira is 41 years old and is a strong, unmarried lady. She has been manufacturing carpets for many years to contribute to the family income. She offers various handmade carpets in different colors and designs to the people of her community and makes enough to lead a decent life. 

In order to improve her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales. She is in her 4th loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester and polypropylene fibers.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad is a 62-year-old farmer who is married and has one child. Saad has a smart 12-year-old boy named Mustafa who always gets high grades in school. At the beginning of every school year, the family faces the problem of making ends meet due to the additional expenses they have in order to cover school fees, the uniform and books. With this loan now they can accommodate all these expenses.

He is requesting a loan to pay for his son's tuition fees and other school expenses. Mustafa’s vision is to be an agricultural engineer in the future. 

The story of Mustafa is just one of the many examples of clients of Izdiharona for Economic Development who are able to get a better education.

Note : He was born on 10-15-2001

loans.use: to pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 38 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has been fattening pigs for two years and also earns additional income from selling food.

Mary Jane is borrowing 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Wa-Yabqa-Alamal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Wa-Yabqa-Alamal, which consists of 4 ladies who work hard to maintain a good family life. They live in Taiz, Yemen.

They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER. Fadia is the leader of this group. She is 27 years old and is a housewife who works hard to improve her living standards. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her home. She hopes to renew her home.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her home

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from selling food.

Virginia is borrowing 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed for her pig-fattening business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 27-year-old single man from Ibb, Yemen. He had a car that he worked to earn daily expenses. His income was really not enough to cover all living expenses: food, clothes, etc. He established a phone accessories business to use to improve his life 6 years ago. He enabled to collect amount to open his business.

He would like to expand his business, so he decided to apply for a youth loan of 160,000 YER from AMB to purchase mobile phone recharge cards for resale. He is sure that this will help him to provide much better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone recharge cards for resale.

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafa is a small business owner in south Iraq. An ambitious entrepreneur, despite traditional roles and cultural norms, she started her business at the age of 42. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Wafa is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Wafa is now 47 years old, a mother of five children. Since her divorce she provides for the family alone. She started her business on a very small scale five years ago and since than it has been steadily growing, attracting new clients, adding new services, and additional machines to her work-space.

Wafa is living in the south of Iraq where, despite relative stability over the past years, conflicts, safety and security issues still complicate life. But Wafa is determined to provide for her family and works hard in her sewing shop day after day. As the pictures show, she mostly works on dresses for women, making the typical home ware dresses that are usually colorful, comfortable and decorated with work-intense details. 

Wafa started her business five years ago and since than it has been steadily growing attracting new clients with her detailed oriented, quality work. Although her business is still relatively small, her hard work and the potential for growth qualifies her to participate in the WLIFT project and also take a business loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq. 

She would like to use her loan of $5000 to improve the workshop by renovating it, expanding it, and buying a new sewing machine, and a small generator - all to ensure she can work more efficiently, plan her work better, and provide better and faster services. In addition, she also plans to buy some nice quality fabrics and raw materials with the remaining amount after purchasing the larger goods.  

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve the workshop by renovating it, expanding it, and buying a new sewing machine, and a small generator

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia es una persona muy trabajadora, en su pequeña despensa se gana el sustento diario para poder cubrir los gastos que dia a dia surgen. Es una persona luchadora y por sobre todo muy emprendedora. Su crédito anterior de Kiva lo utilizo para poder surtir su negocio.
Hoy solicita de nuevo un préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas en general, ya que quiere mejorar su despensa y dar mayores productos a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad de crecer que tiene.
texts.en: Mauricia is a hard-working person. In her small store she labors to cover the expenses that arise daily in supporting her household. She is a fighter and very much an entrepreneur. She used the last loan to stock her store. She is asking for a new loan to buy all kinds of clothing as she wants to improve her shop and offer more products to her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity she has to expand.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Khaledah

texts.en:
Khaledah is a 46 years old Iraqi woman with a sense of entrepreneurship as a response to meet her and her family’s needs. She lives in the south of Iraq, and, as a widow, she is the sole provider for her family, raising her two small sons alone. With her dedicated work and endurance she established her home based sewing workshop in 2003 and has been working hard since then.   

With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Khaledah is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills. She mainly makes dresses for women and children, and in the last 10 years she has worked hard on establishing her clientele and slowly growing her business. 

Khaledah has in the past successfully received and repaid a small Relief International Microfinance Iraq business loan which she used for making her sewing workshop nicer as well as equipping it with required tools and appliances.

Ambitious and with great potential for growth, Khaledah qualifies for the WLIFT program and is taking a new loan to work on further renovation works and expansion of the workshop with a special focus on improving her electrical wiring and purchasing a generator which will allow her to work more efficiently, and have many more work hours by the sewing machine. Electricity in her area is provided for just a couple of hours a day, as such having her own power supply will exponentially improve her business. She also plans to invest in a modern sewing machine to be able to offer more options and creative solutions to her customers and will also purchase quality fabrics and raw materials to work with.

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to work on further renovation works and expansion of the workshop with a special focus on her power supply

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a young, ambitious Iraqi woman, running her own business since 2005. The small enterprise located in the south of Iraq was established after Zahra took a 60 day long course in sewing following the completion of her elementary education.

Zahra is 23 years old, at her young age she is determined and highly dedicated to her business. Although her career options were limited due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Zahra is making the most of her ideas, plans and sewing skills, and with the income she earns, she is able to participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. 

With the potential for growing her business, she qualifies to participate in the WLIFT program and is taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 10,000 USD. She intends to improve her work conditions and make her work more efficient with the purchase of a generator - as electricity in her area is provided for just a couple of hours a day, as such having her own power supply will exponentially improve her business -  a new sewing machine and an air condition unit. Once the large purchases are completed, she will also buy some quality fabrics and raw materials. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to purchase a generator for her sewing business

loans.name: Baneen

texts.en:
Banen is only 19 years old and since 2009 has been working. She lives and works in one of the south governorates of Iraq. 

With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Banen started like just like many other Iraqi women working from home, using their sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of the family. But Banen was able to take her skills and plans to a higher level and now she owns and works in her own small business. 

A true entrepreneur mind, Banen is focusing on bridal gowns and special occasion dresses in her shop. And with her passion and drive as well as with the potential for her business to grow she qualifies to participate in the WLIFT program. The SME loan she is taking from Relief International Microfinance Iraq will provide her with the capital needed to improve and expand her shop, purchase more goods for retail, and to buy a generator as well as an air conditioning unit - as electricity in her area is provided for just a couple of hours a day, as such having her own power supply will improve her work conditions, and A/C will ease the effects of the daily heat for her and her customers as they come for shopping and fittings.

loans.use: to improve and expand her shop, purchase more goods for retail, and to buy a generator

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: As the widowed mother of three children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She earns a living by selling fish in the Philippines, and supplements that income by buying and selling bananas and other items. She is requesting a loan for PHP 5,000 from NWTF to buy fish to sell. Nilda has sustained her business in the past with 15 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 25 years old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of two children; with her family she is living and working in one of the south governorates of Iraq.

Since 2005 she been running her own small business selling electronic household appliances, household and kitchen stuffs and decorative items like the vases visible on the pictures. While the shop on the pictures might carry little significance, Marwa’s small business demonstrates a unique endeavor taken on by a unique woman.

To support Marwa with her plans and with great potential for her business to grow she is qualified to participate in the WLIFT program. Taking an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, she intends to renovate and expand the small shop and increase her capital through the purchase of more goods for retail.  

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renovate and expand the small shop and increase her capital through the purchase of more goods

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a business woman from Iraq, living in one of the south governorates of the country. She is 27 years old, married and a mother of two children. 

She has five years work experience, and after learning the trade while working for others, she decided to open her own boutique in 2012. She is selling clothing for women and children as well as accessories and jewelry for women.  

Her small business qualifies for the WLIFT program and she is taking an SME loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 10,000 USD. She plans to use the loan to increase her capital and purchase more goods and various items for retail in the store.  

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase more goods and various items for retail in the store

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married and works hard to support her family by running a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 13,000 from NWTF to buy additional ingredients. Catherine has been in this business for 10 years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Edjromahu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EDJROMAHU est composé de trois personnes, qui résident dans le même quartier. Conforte (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo), est la représente de ce groupe. Conforte est âgée de 36 ans. Conforte n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Conforte est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de ces enfants le couple a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Conforte vit ensemble avec son mari et ces enfants. Les charges du ménage sont assurées par le couple. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille Conforte vend depuis vingt ans environ du pain accompagné de sardines, avocats,beurre, lait etc. Conforte s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Conforte s’associe avec les autres membres de son groupe  pour solliciter un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The group Edjromahu is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. Conforte (the one who has her hand raised in the photo) is the representative of the group. Conforte is 36 years old. Conforte did not go to school. Conforte is married to one Germain. The couple has four children, all in school and in their care. Besides these children, the couple has two other children in their care. Conforte lives together with her husband and these children. The household expenses are taken care of by the couple. To respond to the family's needs, Conforte has been selling bread and sardines, avocados, butter, milk, etc. for around twenty years. Conforte stocks up in a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business, Conforte joined together with the other members of the group to ask for a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: to buy bread, sardines, avocados, butter, milk, etc. for resale

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima, de  62 años, esta casada con Rodrigo y tiene 8 hijos pero todos ellos son mayores e independientes. Ambos viven juntos en su casa propia. Máxima se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería , estas actividades le han dado muchas satisfacciones, como obtener todos los ingresos económicos que le ayudaron a educar a sus hijos, los que se encuentra viviendo en la ciudad de Lima, posee 5 vacas todas ellas lecheras, de las que produce un promedio de 35 litros diarios, cuenta que cuando tiene crías, llegan a producir 70 litros. Le va muy bien en la crianza de sus animales, su secreto es sembrar por ella misma, la alfalfa con lo cual alimenta a su ganado, “también les doy comida balanceada, les desparasitó y cuido mucho”. De igual manera, siembra maíz, alverja, cebada en terrenos propios y arrendados, los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación. Este es su tercer crédito con KIVA, esta muy contenta de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos. Máxima, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Máxima is 62 years old, married to Rodrigo and has eight children all of whom are adults and independent. She and her husband live together in their own home. Máxima is a farmer and raises livestock. These activities have given her much satisfaction as well as having generated enough income to help educate her children, who now live in Lima. She has five milk cows, which produce an average of 35 liters of milk a day and when they have calves it goes up to 70 liters per day. The business of raising of animals goes well for her. Her secret is that she grows her own feed, alfalfa, which she gives to her cattle. "Also I give them balanced feed, I treat them for parasites and care for them a lot". At the same time she plants corn, peas and barley on her own and rented land, and she is very dedicated at taking care of them too. 

This is her third loan with Kiva. Máxima will use the 2,000 PEN to buy organic fertilizer to nurture her crops. She is very grateful to have this financial backing and she has proven herself to be reliable in her repayments.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Appoline Raissa

texts.fr: Appoline est une femme de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle possède et gère une petite boutique depuis 3 ans dans un quartier de la ville où elle vend des produits alimentaires (sucre, savon, boisson hygiènique, boites de conserve, riz, lait).  Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandises afin de satisfaire sa clientèle grandissante, et d'augmenter ses bénéfices. les bénéfices générés vont être injectés dans son capital d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part
texts.en: Appoline is a 31-year old woman who is married and mother to three children. She has owned and managed a small shop for three years in one of the town's districts and here she sells food products (sugar, soap, soda, canned food, rice, milk). She is requesting this loan to boost her stock of groceries  so that she can satisfy her growing customer base and increase her profits. Part of the profits she generates will be injected into her business and part will be used to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, soda, canned food, rice, and milk for resale

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Dolores works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pre-paid mobile load, direct selling Avon products, farming rice and raising pigs. Dolores is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, energy drinks, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Dolores has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, eggs, energy drinks, soap, shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Dakouma Group

texts.fr:
Mme HAKIRATOU représente le groupe DAKOUMA. Mariée, elle mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 02vont à l’école.
Mme vend des condiments depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les périphéries de Ouaga. Ses clients sont les femmes et les jeunes.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de100kg d’oignons et des épices.
Mme veut économiser ses bénéfices pour construire une maison dans sa parcelle. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mme Hakiratou represents the Dakouma group. She is married and the mother of three children. Her eldest child is 20, and her youngest child is five. Two of her children go to school. 

Mme Hakiratou has been selling condiments for six years. She buys her supplies in the outskirts of Ouaga. Her clients are both women and youth.

She would like to buy two 100 kg bags of onions as well as spices. She would like to construct a house on her plot of land. She would like to secure the education of her children.

loans.use: buy two 100 kg bags of onions as well as spices.

loans.name: Amee Marie

texts.en: Amee Marie is 22 years old. She is single, and she is dedicated to building her business to a high level. She sells different items such as biscuits and cake and bread. The loan she has requested will be used to buy juices and mineral waters and hamburgers for sale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more biscuits, cakes and bread for sale

loans.name: Francois

texts.en:
Francois is 54 years old. He is a father of five children, all of whom go to school. He has spent twenty years in rice growing. With the Kiva loan, Francois would like to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production. The profits from the produce will be used to help the family to have a better standard of living, through providing the required support.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans according to figures as of 2009. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. 

Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market, and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for use in rice production.

loans.name: Gbevivi Ii 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEVIVI II est composé de dix neuf membres qui dans le même village. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Ephrasie(est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 30 ans. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ephrasie est mariée à un conducteur de taxi du nom de Roger. Le couple a quatre enfants,dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Ephrasie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les charges du ménage. Depuis quinze ans, Ephrasie exerce comme activité la vente des noix de palme dans a région. Ephrasie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Ephrasie ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEVIVI II sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de développé son activité afin de devenir un grossiste.
texts.en: The group GBEVIVI II consists of nineteen members who live in the same town. The leader of this group, named Ephrasie (the one with one hand raised in the photo), is 30 years old. With the goal of raising the level of their business in order to better meet the demands of their clientele, this group is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the first time. Ephrasie is married to a taxi driver named Roger. The couple has four children, of whom certain ones go to school and are under their care. Ephrasie lives together with her husband and her children. The couple takes care of the household responsibilities together. For fifteen years, Ephrasie has been in business selling palm nuts in her region. Ephrasie gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With the goal of strengthening her business and satisfying her clientele, Ephrasie is requesting a first loan from Alidé together with the other members of the group GBEVIVI II. Her ambition is to develop her business in order to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des produits cosmétiques pour revendre, madame Ami fait sa première demande de crédit à WAGES. Le profit tiré de la vente lui permettra de réinvestir dans son activité et d'assurer les besoins vitaux de la famille. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur. Ami âgée de 27ans a une ancienneté d'1an dans l'activité.
texts.en: In order to buy cosmetic products to resell, madam Ami is making her first loan request to WAGES. The profits made from her sales will allow her to reinvest in her business and to ensure the vital needs of her family. She is married to a driver. Ami is 27 years old and has 1 year of experience in her business.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Mme AGUIARATA représente le groupe DJIGUIYA. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et a 02personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son secteur. Ses clients sont les amies et les  collègues.
Elle veut s’acheter 18complet pagnes et 20tenues pour bébé.
