He has been renting out internet access booths for 13 years. In his free time he builds houses. Years ago he was an official bricklayer. His greatest desire is to update his internet business. 

He will invest the loan in the purchase of new keyboards and headphones. His greatest wish is for his son to finish his studies. 

The group thanks the Kiva investors for the loan they provide. Ricardo is the first on the left side, wearing a red vest with black and gray.

loans.use: to buy new keyboards and headphones

loans.name: Sayohat

texts.ru: Саёхат доброжелательная женщина. Она живет вместе со своей семьей в сельской местности. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети не совершеннолетние. Ее муж занимается предоставлением услуги строителя. Саёхат более 8 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Дополнительно она занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как помидор и капуста. Саёхат трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина, и поэтому она введет своё дело отлично. Она должна купить школьные принадлежности и школьные формы для своих детей, так как ее дети еще школьники. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sayohat is a kind woman. She lives together with her family in a rural area. She is 34 years old. She is married and is raising three children. Her children are underage. Her husband is a construction worker. Sayohat has been providing sewing services for over eight years. Additionally she has been cultivating field crops such as tomatoes and cabbage. Sayohat is a hardworking and purposeful woman and that is why she runs her business excellently. She has to buy school supplies and uniform for her children because they are still school age. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,500 somoni. She is waiting for your generosity and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy school supplies and uniform for her children.

loans.name: Khayriniso

texts.ru: Хайринисо 60 лет. Она трудолюбивая женщина и заботливая мать 3 детей. Она более 17 лет занимается скотоводством. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке по более высокой ценой, чем она приобрела. Раньше ей помогал муж, а теперь ей помогают дети по введению бизнеса. Ее муж умер несколько лет назад. Хайринисо планирует развевать бизнес дальше и с такой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы пополнить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Khayriniso is 60 years old. She is a hardworking woman and a mother of three children. She has been doing animal husbandry for over seventeen years. She buys cattle, feeds it for several months and then sells it on the local market at a higher price than what she bought at. Her husband used to help her, but now her children help her run the business. Her husband passed away several years ago. Khayriniso plans to grow her business and with this purpose she is asking for a loan in the amount of $3,000 USD to buy cattle to replenish her working capital. She is waiting for your generosity and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase working capital.

loans.name: Megjid

texts.en:
Megjid is a married, 28 year-old father of three children between the ages of 15 months and 8 years old. For a long time, Megjid and his wife have owned a food shop. They both really enjoy working together in the shop. They started off very small but they have managed through the years to expand and offer a variety of foods.

Megjid is satisfied with his business and only wants enough of a loan to be able to expand the business and buy more food products. He is very happy for the financial support that KosInvest gives him because he is certain that he will make progress in his work. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank the lenders for their support!

loans.use: To expand and buy more food products for his food shop.

loans.name: Gëzim

texts.en:
Gëzim is a 37-year-old single male who lives with his father, sister and brother in the Ashkali community. His mother died many years ago. They own a small old house that is in need of renovation and has not had any repairs in the last several years. One of the main problems is the insufficient insulation, with the house losing much heat in the winter time. Gëzim is the main source of income for his family but he makes very little income working in a market and on the street selling mobile phones.  

Every winter, it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm. For this reason, Gëzim is requesting a loan for the first time to improve and address the insulation problem. This will then allow his family to live a normal and healthy life and save on the heating costs in the winter. He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: to renovate the rooms in his house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Yolanda works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling personal products. Yolanda is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more items such as pants, bags, slippers and school supplies.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as pants, bags, slippers and school supplies.

loans.name: Jura

texts.ru: Джура 50 лет. Он женат и имеет 3 детей. Его жена занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. Джура более 20 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Он вначале занимался перевозкой пассажиров на маршрутке. Данное время он имеет автомашину марки Опель-Астра и занимается услуги такси. Джура имеет большой опыт в этой сфере. Он использует свой доход для покупки продуктов питания для содержания семьи. Скоро он планирует провести мероприятие в семье, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Jura is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife cultivates field crops. Jura has been providing taxi services for over twenty years. In the beginning he has been transporting passengers on a route bus. At this time he has a car by make of Opel-Astra and provides taxi services. Jura has a good experience in this field of work. He uses his income to buy food to support his family. Soon he plans to hold an event in his family, but does not have enough money. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 3,000 somoni to hold a party. He is waiting for your generosity and hopes for your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a party for his family.

loans.name: Sandra Isabel

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 29 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara ella tiene mas de 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como blusas, camisas, ropa de niños, sandalias, etc. este negocio lo tiene en su casa y también vende de manera ambulante. Sandra ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para comprar mercadería como ser blusas, pantalones, sandalias y ropa de niños. Su propósito es aumentar las ventas para lograr una estabilidad económica para lograr cumplir sus metas que es sacar adelante a su familia y hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Sandra is 29 years old. She is a single mother of two children and lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. For more than three years, she has been selling merchandise such as blouses, shirts, children's clothing, sandals, etc. She has this business in her house and she also sells as a street vendor. Sandra has decided to take out a loan for 15,000 lempiras to buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, sandals and children's clothes. Her objective is to increase sales to achieve financial stability to meet her goals, which are to get her family ahead and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as blouses, children's clothes, and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Mohirakhon

texts.ru: Мохирахон 38-летняя замужняя женщина. Она мать четверых детей. У Мохирахон муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Она с детьми живет в Таджикистане, в маленьком районе Дж.Руми. Так как ее муж очень далеко находится, за воспитанием детей она взялась сама. Мохирахон домохозяйка, в основном свое свободное время проводит дома. У нее хорошо получается шить женские наряды. Мохирахон сидя дома решила зарабатывать- принимать заказы на шитье женских платьев. Она просит кредит для покупки модернизированной компьютерной швейной машины и необходимых тканей. Мохирахон в будущем надеется провести свадьбу дочери за счет полученной прибыли.
texts.en: Mohirakhon is a 38 year old married woman. She is a mother of four children. Mohirakhon's husband went to Russia for work. Together with her children she lives in Tajikistan in a small region of J. Rumy. As her husband is now far away she has to raise her children herself. Mohirakhon is a homemaker and mainly spends the time at home. She is very good at sewing women's outfits. Mohirakhon decided to make a living from home and take orders to make women's dresses. She is asking for a loan to buy a modern electronic sewing machine and necessary fabrics. Mohirakhon hopes to hold a wedding for her daughter in the future using the profit.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine and necessary fabrics to start a sewing business and use the profit to hold a wedding for her daughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for education.

loans.name: Delmy Aracely

texts.es: Doña Delmy de 52 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija de 23 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa lo hace de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias donde reside, y por las tardes vende en su casa, es una persona humilde, muy trabajadora  y responsable con los gastos de su hogar, doña Delmy esta solicitando un crédito  para poder  compra mas mercadería por mayor y poder surtir aun mas su negocio comprando faldas, blusas y camisas,  y así obtener mejores ganancias y  mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Delmy is 52 years old. She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her 23 year old daughter. She sells clothes as a street vendor in different neighborhoods where she lives. in the afternoon, she sells from her house. She is a humble person who is very hardworking and responsible with her household expenses. Delmy is asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise wholesale and stock her business even more, buying skirts, blouses and shirts. This way, she can obtain more earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy skirts, blouses and shirts.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida, de 44 años es una mujer seria. Vive en compañía de su esposo Fernando. Ambos tienen 7 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su casa propia. Se siente desarrollada; pues gracias su esfuerzo pudo adquirir una fábrica de ladrillos. Cuenta que todos la ayudan: sus hijas y yernos; por eso se siente feliz, ya que puede brindar un apoyo a su familia, “el trabajo es muy duro y se necesita de muchas personas”, afirma Zenaida. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia en su negocio, es por ello que siempre cuenta con pedidos de clientes fijos. Al mes realiza 22 millares vendiendo estos a buen precio en la misma fábrica sin tener que trasladarlos a otro lugar. Ahora desea comprar nuevos hornos de mayor tecnología, pues solo lo realiza de manera rústica el quemado de los ladrillos que realiza junto a su familia. Este es su quinto préstamo con kiva por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Zenaida; invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de madera para la realización de los ladrillos.
texts.en:
Zenaida is 44 years old and is a serious woman. She lives with her husband Fernando. They both have 7 children, but they only live with 5 of them in their own home. She feels fulfilled because thanks to her efforts she was able to acquire a brick factory. She says that everyone helps her: her daughters and her sons in law. that is why she feels happy, because she can offer support to her family. “The work is very hard and it needs a lot of people", affirms  Zenaida. She has 20 years experience already in the business and that is why she always has orders from regular customers. Every month she makes 22 thousand, selling them at a good price in the factory itself without having to transport them to a different place. Now she wants to buy new kilns with better technology, because she just bakes the bricks in a rustic way with her family. This is her fifth loan with Kiva and so she is grateful for the support with which she will achieve her goals. She is also committed to making her payments.

Zenaida will invest the S/.1000 soles in buying wood to make the bricks.

loans.use: to buy wood to manufacture bricks.

loans.name: Sladjana

texts.en:
Sladana is a 44-years-old married mother of two children ages 13 and 21. Together, they all live in a minority community in Kosovo. Sladana is working in a primary school as a technical helper and her husband receives a pension from the work that he had done prior to the war in Kosovo. After the war he was unable to return to any type of work and Sladana has been the primary source of the family’s income.

Their house has not had any repairs for long time and she has wanted to do general renovations but only recently has been able to manage to save the money. Sladana is asking for a loan buy the necessary material to renovate and reconstruct the façade of the house. The loan will help her realize her goals and have better living conditions in the future for her family. She appreciates all of the Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to renovate and reconstruct the house.

loans.name: Rahima

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Rahima works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits and vegetables vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Rahima is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Rahima has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Sevdije

texts.en:
The borrower, Sevdije, is 32 years-old and a mother of 5 children ranging from 1 to 10 years old.  They live in the southern part of Kosovo in a Roma community. Although Sevdije is not working at all she receives a small amount of money as part of a social pension and her husband works sometimes doing construction and transporting goods for others when there is a need. This loving family lives in very poor conditions but Sevdije is still always smiling despite her situation. The house that she and her family live in is very old and needs urgent renovation. 

Sevdije is in need of a loan so that she can change the doors and windows before the winter comes. This loan will help her to keep her utility costs down and reduce expenses to keep the house warm during the winter. In addition, by addressing the insulation issues, she will be able to keep her family healthy and reduce the risk of illness and cold. Since she has five children, it is very difficult for her to secure the basic things for living not to mention being able to address improving living conditions to a standard that is acceptable. 

“Without this loan we will have cold and problems with heating this winter as we had before,” claims Sevdije.

The loan will help them to have a better life with comfortable conditions and improve the quality of life to an acceptable standard. In the future she hopes to offer a better education for their children. Sevdije and her family want to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to change  doors and windows.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 49 años es una mujer sencilla. Hace 24 años enviudó y desde entonces cuida de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 3 de ellos; en su casa propia. A pesar de que sus hijos son mayores y ya conformaron su familia. Ella continua viviendo con ellos, pues siempre soñó con criar a sus nietas. Su principal actividad económica es la crianza de ganado vacuno, posee 5 vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen y las vende a sus vecinos quienes conocedores de la rica leche que producen sus animales le comprar todos los días. Además de criar ovejas y gallinas para su consumo, pero cuenta que si tiene cualquier eventualidad los vende engordándolos al mercado. “Posee grandes extensiones de terreno los que me sirve para sembrar alfalfa y avena lo que me sirve para alimentar a mis animales, este año empecé a vender alfalfa a los demás ganaderos de mi zona”, afirma. Por el momento desea vivir mucho tiempo para ver a sus nietas crecer y así velar por su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con kiva por tanto agradece su apoyo, con el cual logrará cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. María; invertirá los S/.800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old and a simple woman. She was widowed 24 years ago and has cared for her four sons since then. She lives with only three of the four, in her own house. Although her sons are adults and have a family, she still lives with them, as she had always dreamed of raising her grandchildren.

Her main economic activity is raising cows. She has five cows from which she gets milk, which she sells to her neighbors. Being familiar with the delicious milk that her animals produce, they buy it from her every day. She also raises sheep and hens for her own use, but keeps in mind that if she has to deal with some eventuality, she will fatten them and sell them at the market.

"I have large fields which I use to plant alfalfa and oats that I use to feed my animals. This year I will start to sell alfalfa to the other cattle breeders in my area," she says. At present she wants to live a long time so she can see her grandchildren grow and keep watch over her family. 

This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and so she is grateful for their support, with which she will achieve her goals. In turn she promises to make her monthly payments. María will invest the 800 Peruvian soles (PEN) to buy manure to nourish her fields.

loans.use: to buy manure

loans.name: Komla Dodji

texts.fr:
Dodji a 25 ans. Il vit dans le quartier Adidogomé et est chauffeur de taxi depuis 2005. 
Mais Il y a deux ans, en raison des pannes récurrentes de la voiture, il a débuté le commerce des chaussures usées pour adultes et enfants. Il s’approvisionne 02 fois par semaine dans le marché Hédzranawoé et revend les chaussures au bord de la route.
Bientôt la rentrée scolaire, il souhaite avoir un prêt pour  acheter 11 paires de chaussure de sport et des chaussures pour enfant.  Ce micro crédit lui permettra d’agrandir son activité pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en: Dodji is 25 years old. He lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé, and was a taxi driver from 2005 until 2011. Two years ago, given the recurrent breakdowns of the car, he began to sell used shoes for adults and children. He stocks up twice a week from the Hédzranawoé market and sell the shoes on the side of the road. As the new school year appraoches, he is asking for a loan in order to purchase 11 pairs of sports shoes and shoes for children. This loan will allow him to increase his activity level and attract a larger number of clients.

loans.use: purchase 11 pairs of sports shoes

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    TIESSIRI est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de27 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2éme prêt. Le précédent prêt à été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  poissons à l’image de MAH qui est la 1ére  femme debout dans la photo de la gauche à la droite  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 20Kg de poisson fumés  avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The TIESSIRI group is comprised of 4 women, all of whom are married and are, on average, 27 years old and have three children. They live in traditional large families with their husbands, co-spouses, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They met each other through living in the same neighborhood, being involved in the same commercial activity, and through friendship. In order to reinforce their financial capacity in order to improve their businesses, they joined the microfinance institutions Soro Yiriwaso and are currently asking for their second loan. The first loan was sucessfully reimbursed. This group of women sell fish. MAH, seen in the photo as the first woman on the left, plans to use this loan to purchase 20 kilos of smoked fish from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her fish at the market as well as through a door to door model, for cash or credit, to a customers base largely composed of women. She hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 15 000 FCFA which she plans to use to further invest in her business and reimburse her loan.

loans.use: purchase fish

loans.name: Mawunyo

texts.fr:
Mawunyo vit dans le quartier Adidogomé. Il a 26 ans et est en apprentissage en menuiserie. 
Mawunyo n’a pas pu continuer la formation par faute de moyens.
Mais par contre, ayant acquis quelques notions, il peut fabriquer des tabourets, des tables pour revendre au bord de la route.
Mawunyo  sollicite un crédit pour acheter 03 planches, 02 sachets de clous et 1l de vernis.
Les revenus lui permettront de poursuivre sa formation et de subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en: Mawunyo lives in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. He is 26 years old and an apprentice in carpentry. He was unable to continue his training due to a lack of funds. However, having acquired several skills, he is able to build tables and stools to sell on the side of the road. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase three planks of wood, two bags of nails and one liter of varnish. Revenues from these will allow him to pursue his apprenticeship and cover his needs.

loans.use: purchase three planks of wood, two bags of nails and one liter of varnish

loans.name: David Mauricio

texts.es: Don David de 40 años de edad  vive en casa propia  con sus 2 hijos  y su compañero de vida,  él se dedica a cultivar maíz y frijol  tiene 11 años de dedicarse a esa actividad y es así como ha podido sacar adelante a su familia,  con lo que gana de sus ventas logra cubrir unos gastos de su hogar, ahora el solicita un crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plaga, herbicidas, etc. y poder mejorar sus ingresos y tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
David, 40, live in his own house with his two children and his life partner.

David makes a living growing corn and beans.  He has done this job for 11 years and has been able to get his family ahead.  He manages to cover some of his household expenses with what he earns from his sales.

He's requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc., to improve his income and have greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pest control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a machine for painting vehicles

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie is 37 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Vangie is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Vangie has been buying and selling livestock for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Shukrije

texts.en:
Shukrije is 48 years old. She is happily married to her husband and is the mother of a 7-year-old son. She is currently working in a police station as an administrator and her husband is working as a guard. Both of them receive very low salaries. For several years Shukrije has wanted to do renovations on her house.  She has tried unsuccessfully to save the money for the costs. 

Now, for the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to change the windows and doors and to improve the facade of her house.  She would like to address the longstanding heat loss problems she has. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy the coal to keep this house warm. Shukrije believes that after renovating the house, she will be able to create better living conditions for the family by keeping them healthy and lowering their cost of living. Shukrije appreciates the help from KosInvest/Kiva.

loans.use: to change the windows and doors and to improve the facade of her house.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo, who is married, works hard to support her family through her food-vending business in the Philippines. In business for 10 years now, she has requested a PHP 23000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and bread for her enterprise. Amparo would like to build and expand her operation to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and bread for her business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 56 years old and is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Antonia has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. Antonia requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Antonia has been in this business for 10 years. Antonia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn, a 32-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school, has been raising livestock in the Philippines for 15 years now. Having received 13 previous loans from NWTF, she is requesting a new one for PHP 19000 to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.


Analyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia works hard to support her family. Basilia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Basilia requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like peanuts, butter, sugar, etc. for her business.

Basilia has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Basilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like peanuts, butter, sugar, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is 62 years old and is married with ten children. Clara works very hard to provide for them.

Clara runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of bread, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Clara has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. 

Clara would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of bread, snack foods, noodles, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon is 29 years old and lives with her spouse and a son (pictured) in Svay Antor district of Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Farming is the major source of her family’s income. She learned this business from her parents and has worked as a farmer on her own land since 2009. She is fortunate to have her husband's full support in managing their farm.

Nguon requested a loan of 500 USD to build a bathroom. This will be valuable to her family and improve their quality of life because there is currently no bathroom in the house. More importantly, the family will release less pollutants and will contribute to the efforts against air pollution. She hopes lenders will accept her loan which is her first through HKL. She is thankful and promises to pay back the loan punctually.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is a 28-year-old married father of a one-year-old daughter. Bajram works in a pizza restaurant in his area while his wife stays at home taking care of the family. Together they live in the southern part of Kosovo. He is a very hard worker who works many long hours, from early morning to the night as a way to support his family. Recently they moved in a new house but were unable to complete all of the necessary tasks due to his lack of income. 

He is now requesting a loan for the first time, so that he can pay for installing electricity and water supply. This loan will be of great help to him since, without it, he would not be able to manage to complete these improvements and provide a safe and healthy environment for his family. His goal is to find a better paying job so that in the future he will be able to offer better living conditions and quality of life to his family. Knowing that it is a Kiva loan he would like to thank all lenders!

loans.use: to pay for installing electricity and water supply.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.ru: Садриддин добросовестный человек. Ему 50 лет. Он женат и имеет 4 детей. Его жена занимается земледелием. Садриддин более 35 лет занимается плотничеством. Он изготавливает двери и рамы. Садриддин имеет все необходимые станки. Он с 15 лет учился у мастера этому ремеслу и с 18 лет самостоятельно занимается своим делом. Он планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Садриддин запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, арматура и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Sadriddin is a conscientious person. He is 50, married, and has four children. His wife works in agriculture.  Sadriddin has been a carpenter for more than 35 years. He makes doors and frames, and has all the necessary tools. He apprenticed with a master carpenter when he was 15, and has been working independently since he was 18. He is planning on repairing his house, but cannot afford it. Sadriddin is requesting as loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, lumber, fittings, etc. He awaits for your kind assistance and is relying on your compassion.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing his house

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en: Honorio is 35 years old, married and has children who he supports through his farming business. He wanted to increase his income but had insufficient capital; that is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides that will be used on his form to increase his yield. He hopes to become a successful rice grower and will keep providing for the needs of his family as each of the members of his family supports one another in improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides that will be used on his farm

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат 43 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она более 13 лет занимается скотоводством. Ее муж Акбар помогает ей по введению бизнеса. Они стараются, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование. Сабохат одновременно работает медсестрой в медицинском пункте села. Ее сын учится в университете, и она должна  оплатить за учебный договор своего сына. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Sabokhat is 43, married, and has three children. She has been engaged in animal husbandry for more than 13 years. Her husband Akbar helps her run the business. They are trying to ensure that their children receive a college education. Sabokhat also works as a midwife at the village clinic. Her son is studying at the university, and his tuition has to be payed. They are requesting a loan to pay for his tuition. They await your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college tuition

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer de 49 años de edad casada la cual goza de una excelente salud suficiente energía y muchos ánimos para trabajar. Ella trabaja en compañía de su esposo y su familia la cual es muy numerosa compuesta por 8 hijos de los cuales solo tres viven con ellos los cuales están a su cargo ya que son menores y estudian en la primaria. En familia se dedican a la siembra y cultivo de café ya que ella aprendió desde pequeña en compañía de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra ya que no pudieron apoyarla en sus estudios pudiendo cursar hasta el segundo grado de primaria; porque eran de escasos recursos económicos entonces ella decidió aprender a trabajar y ayudarle a su familia para salir adelante. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde ella habita por lo que el mantenimiento y asistencia se le es más fácil de dar para protección y cuidado. Sus sueños como madre de familia es poder educar a sus hijos para que ellos puedan vivir en buenas condiciones y darles una mejor y mayor calidad de vida con un nivel educativo superior como también los de agrandar más sus cultivos sembrando una mejor y más atractiva variedad de café.

Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para  la compra de 10 QQ de urea, 5 QQ de abono 18-46-0, 8 QQ formula cafetalera y 5 QQ de fórmula de crecimiento para poder asistir sus cultivos y obtener una mejor producción y una mejor ganancia de la venta misma.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is a 49 year old married woman who is in excellent health with plenty of energy and spirit to work. She works in a company belonging to her husband and her family. Her family is large: it is made up of 8 children; only three of them live with their parents. She takes care of them because they are minors and are studying in primary school. 

Her family works sowing and cultivating coffee because she learned this at an early age from her parents. They were the ones to teach her how to work the soil, because they were unable to support her in her studies. She only completed the second grade. Due to scarce economic resources, she decided to learn to work and help her family to get ahead. Her coffee plants are located on the same property as where she lives, so the maintenance and assistance they need is easier to give for their protection and care. Her dream, as the mother of her family, is to be able to educate her children so that they can live in good conditions and to give them a better quality of life with a higher level of education. She also dreams of improving her plants by sowing a better and more attractive variety of coffee.

So today she is asking the co-op bank COMIXMUL for funding to buy 10 quintals of urea, 5 quintals of 18-46-0 fertilizer, 8 quintals of coffee formula fertilizer, and 5 quintals of growth formula to be able to help her plants and get better output and higher profits from the same sales.

loans.use: to buy agricultural consumables for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Damin

texts.ru:
Дамину 53 года, он живет в районе Спитамен. Он просит кредит, чтобы открыть собственный бизнес "Откорм-продажа скота". Его собственный капитал составляет 3000 таджикских сомони. Дамин собирается содержать скот во дворе своего дома, в коровнике. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение двух месяцев и после продавать их на местном рынке по хорошей цене. Дамин хочет приобрести для начала трех голов крупнорогатого скота. Сам Дамин работает в средней образовательной школе директором. Ему нравится его дело. У Дамина есть жена, двое сыновей и невестка. Сыновья работают в загранице, тем самым помогают родителям материально. К тому же у Дамина есть небольшой земельный участок, где он со своей женой каждый год выращивает рис. Дамин ответственный человек, на которого можно положиться. 
Благодаря данному кредиту у Дамина будет собственный прибыльный бизнес, что позволит ему увеличить финансовый бюджет семьи.
texts.en:
Damin is 53 and lives in Spitamen. He is requesting a loan to open his own "fatten and resell livestock" business. He has 3000 Tajik somoni as capital. He plans on keeping the animals in a shed next to where he lives. He will fatten the animals for two months and then sell them at the market for a good price. To begin, Damin wants to purchase three head of cattle. Damin himself works as a high school principal, and likes his job. He has a wife, two children, and a sister-in-law. His sons are working abroad, and are able to give their father some financial help. Damin also has a small plot of land where he and his wife grow rice. Damin is a responsible, reliable person.
Thanks to this loan, Damin will have his own profitable business, which will enable him to augment his family's budget.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle to start a business fattening and reselling livestock

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: juana de 29 años de edad vive en casa alquilada con su familia, es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, humilde, desde hace 5 años ella se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, juana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder obtener una mejor cosecha y asi obtener mejores ganancias que le ayuden a seguir dándole a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Juana, age 29, lives in a rented house with her family. She is a very hardworking, responsible, and humble person. For the past five years she has worked in agriculture, especially in the farming of corn and beans. She sells her products in the markets near her place of residence. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to take care of some household expenses. Juana is asking for a loan to buy herbicides, fertilizers, soil supplements, pest control products, etc., to be able to have a better harvest and thus a better profit. This will help her to keep giving her family what they need without some type of restriction.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizers, soil supplements, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive  en casa propia con su madre, él se dedica a la crianza de  ganado de engorde desde hace 2 años,  adicional a eso trabaja de jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, es una persona  con muchas ganas de salir adelante, muy trabajador, además se le considera muy buena persona, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y el pago de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su casa,  el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado de engorde y poder comercializarlo, para obtener mayores ingresos y poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in his own home with his mother. He has raised livestock for fattening for two years. He also works as a day labourer on a farm near to his home. He has a great desire to succeed, and he is very hard-working. He is considered to be a very good person. With his income from his sales and his work he is able to cover some household costs. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock for fattening and later sale in order to obtain a greater income and obtain a greater quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su familia, él se dedica  al cultivo de sorgo y maicillo, tiene muy buenas referencias de parte de sus vecinos,  es una persona muy trabajadora,  responsable  con sus cosas y su trabajo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, el cliente solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. y asi mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in his own home with his family. He cultivates varieties of sorghum. He has very good references from his neighbours. He is very hard-working and is responsible with his possessions and his work. He sells his products in the various markets near to his home. He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of herbicides, fertilizers, manure, seeds, etc. This way, he will improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 55 años y vive en compañia de su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Yolanda tiene una ferretería, equipada y surtida. Según cuenta le va muy bien en su negocio; pues abre sus puertas todos los días sin descanso. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, no solo se dedica a ello, también vende comida los domingos, en un espacio de su casa. Por su parte, su esposo se dedica al alquiler de maquinarias pesadas a instituciones del estado y constructoras privadas, las que le brindan un pago mensual, con ello paga los estudios universitarios de sus hijos; a quienes desea brindarles una buena educación. Ahora quiere surtir su tienda, con todo el material posible, “existen días en las que llegan compradores grandes que se llevan cemento y demás materiales por cantidad y no me abastezco”, afirma. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Yolanda, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de arena, cemento, clavos y demás mercadería para surtir su ferretería.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 55, lives with her husband and two children in their own home. Yolanda has an equipped and stocked hardware store. She says that her business is going very well. She opens her doors every day without a break. However, since she is a hard-working woman, she does not only do this job; she also sells food on Sundays in a space in her home. Her husband rents out heavy machinery to state institutions and private builders. This provides a monthly income which he uses to pay for their children's university education. They want to provide their children with a good education. 
Yolanda wants to stock her store with all the materials possible. "There are days when big buyers arrive and they buy large quantities of cement and other materials, and I don't have enough", she says. This is her sixth loan on Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She promises to repay her quotas punctually. Yolanda will invest the 3,500 soles in the purchase of sand, cement, nails, and other merchandise to stock her hardware store.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, nails, and other items.

loans.name: Yerdeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    YERDEME est constitué de 7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le  village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4éme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  viande
à l’image de  MAH qui est la la 1ére femme assise de la gauche vers la droite Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 10 Kg de viande par jour  avec les bouchers. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Yerdeme group is made up of seven women. They are all married and are on average 37 years old, with three children on average. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the village of Meridiela. 

The group members know each other through being neighbours, friends and business associates. In the interest of increasing their capital and improving their businesses, they are members of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their fourth loan and the three previous loans were all paid in full. 

The women are involved in trading meat, like Mah, who is pictured sitting on the left. 

Mah intends to use her loan to buy 10kg of meat from the butchers each day. She sells to individuals at the market and from home, both for cash and on credit. Most of her customers are women. 

Mah is hoping to make an average of 20 000 CFA francs per month, which will be re-invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia  con su compañero de vida  y su hijo de tres años de edad, ella  tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la agricultura especialmente a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy dedicada a sus actividades, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para su siembra como: herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para poder obtener mejores  cultivos y mejores ingresos y de esa manera poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The client lives in her own home with her partner and their three-year-old child. She has worked in agriculture for three years, specifically in the cultivation of corn and sorghum. She is a very hard-working person and is very dedicated to her work. She sells her products in the various markets near to her home. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of everything necessary for planting, such as: herbicides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc. This will allow her to obtain better crops and a better income; this way, she will be able to obtain a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosa es originaria de la ciudad de Boaco. Tiene 32 años de edad, casada y madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de queso desde hace 17 años. Empezó esta actividad con el apoyo de su mama, poco a poco fue independizándose hasta tener su propio negocio. Comercializa sus productos en su casa. Su expectativa es  administrar bien su negocio con el fin de crecer económicamente. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos  como: Arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite, jabón, pasta dental,  entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que al adquirir el crédito, las ventas aumentaran por la cantidad de productos que ofrece. Su meta futuro es tener una distribuidora con el objetivo de comprar y vender al por mayor. Su plan próximo  es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Rosa was born in the city of Boaco. She is 32 years old and is married with 4 children. 

She is a store owner. For the past 17 years, she has earned a living selling cheese and running a small grocery store. She began this business with the support of her mother and gradually became more independent until she had her own business. She sells her products from home. 

Her plan is to manage her business well so as to promote financial growth. 

She is requesting the loan to buy products such as: rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, soap, toothpaste, and other items in order to supply her business with stock and meet the needs of her customers. 

She believes that when she receives the loan, sales will increase due to the amount of products she offers. 

Her long term goal is to become a distributor that buys and sells wholesale. Her short term plan is to improve her home's infrastructure.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, soap, toothpaste, and other items.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth, aged 38, is married to a farmer and they have four children. She has been working in her direct selling business for almost 5 years, and earning a net income of PHP 4,000 each month. She has insufficient capital in her business, so she requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase lotions, colognes, bags, umbrellas, lipstick, talc powder, and shampoo to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can expand and improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase lotions, colognes, bags, umbrellas, lipstick, talc powder, and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Sabra

texts.en:
Sabra is a 39-year-old married woman; her husband has grown old and does not work. She is taking a loan for her elder son. Her son sews the garments and earns to support his family. He has many sewing machines and over-lock machines which are in need of maintenance. He does not have the funds to fix the problem at this time. If he is unable to fix the machines, he has to face low production and reduced income. Therefore, Sabra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to maintain the machines and derive a reasonable income. 
She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her sewing and over-lock machines.

loans.name: Henry Antonio

texts.es: Henry, tiene 21 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. El estuvo trabajando en una hacienda pero hace un año se dedico a la venta de productos plásticos como panas, tinas, cubetas, tazas, vasos y otros plásticos, también vende ventiladores. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 20,000 lempiras para surtir mas el negocio con productos plásticos como platos, vasos, tazas, lavamanos, cubetas, panas etc. y poder aumentar las ventas. Su plan es mejorar los ingresos para ayudar a sus hijos con la manutención y también hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en: Henry, age 21, is single, has two children, and lives in the town of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. He was working on a ranch, but one year ago he began to work selling plastic products such as trays, tubs, buckets, cups, glasses, and other plastic items. He also sells fans. He has asked for a loan of 20,000 lempiras to restock his business with plastic products such as plates, glasses, cups, washbasins, pails, trays, etc., and be able to increase his sales. His plan is to improve his income to help his children with child support and also to make his business grow.

loans.use: to stock his business with plastic products such as plates, glasses, cups, washbasins, pails, trays, etc.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    YEREDON est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de48 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leurs 10éme prêt. Les 9 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de riz
à l’image de KONIMBA qui est la 1ére femme debout dans la photos de la droite vers la gauche Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 550Kg de riz importé avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Yeredon group is made up of four women. They are all married and are on average 48 years old, with three children on average. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the village of Meridiela. 

The group members know each other through being neighbours, friends and business associates. In the interest of increasing their capital and improving their businesses, they are members of the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their tenth loan. The nine previous loans were all repaid in full. 

The women are involved in trading rice, like Konimba, who is pictured standing on the far right. 

With her loan, Konimba intends to purchase 550kg of imported rice from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells to individuals at the market and from home, both for cash and on credit. Most of her customers are women. 

Konimba is expecting to make an average of 30 000 CFA francs per month, which will be re-invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Luis Alcides

texts.es:
Luis ha crecido en su negocio gracias al apoyo que Fundación Alternativa le ha brindado, pues lleva trabajando con esta IMF desde hace 9 meses y está muy a gusto con la atención personalizada que allí le brindan y qeu además le sirve para adquirir herramientas que le facilitan la administración de su negocio. 
A pesar de vvir a 4 horas de la vía principal, Luis se las arregla para poder ir al pueblo a repartir la leche que producen sus vacas. 
Las últimas vacas que adquirió las vendió en el mercado local y ahora requiere un préstamo para adquirir nuevo ganado y que así la producción de leche se incremente. Luis invierte 12 horas desde las 5 am. hasta alrededor de las 5 de la tarde. Aunque no recibe ayuda, él disfruta su trabajo que lo aprendió desde que era un niño. 
Luis espera siempre tener su patrimonio seguro para que además su hijo no sufra necesidades.
texts.en:
Luis has grown his business thanks to the support that Fundación Alternativa has given him. He has worked with this field partner for 9 months and the personalized attention that they give him suits him well. Additionally, it helps him to get tools that facilitate the administration of his business.

In spite of living 4 hours from the main road, Luis has arranged to be able to go to town to distribute the milk that his cows produce.

He sold the last cows he got in the local market and now he needs a loan to get new cows, and thus increase milk production. Luis invests 12 hours in his work, from 5 a.m. until about 5 p.m. Although he doesn’t have help, he enjoys this job of his that he learned as a child.

Luis hopes to always keep his estate safe so that his children don’t suffer from being needy.

loans.use: to acquire cattle and increase milk production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ambos trabajan en la agricultura desde hace 3 años, es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y responsable  en sus labores se dedica a la siembra de maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos n los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logar solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para su siembra como: herbicidas, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para poder obtener mejores cultivos y mejores ingresos y de esa manera poder alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower lives in her own house with her partner, who, like her, has worked in agriculture for the last three years. She is a friendly, hardworking and responsible person who works growing corn and sorghum, which she sells in the various markets in her area. With the money she earns, she is able to pay for some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy everything she needs for her crops, such as weedkiller, fertiliser, seeds etc. By achieving better yields she can increase her earnings and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy weedkiller, fertiliser, seeds etc.

loans.name: Abbé Faustine

texts.fr:
Faustine est mariée et a un enfant. Depuis 06 ans, elle mène son activité de coiffure dans le quartier Adidogomé, lieu où elle réside.
Vu la croissance de sa clientèle et les besoins répétitifs de son salon qui l’amène à s’approvisionner au moins 02 fois dans la semaine,
Faustine sollicite un crédit pour se procurer de 2 douzaines de mèches et tissages. Les revenus de son activité lui permettront de d’améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Faustine is married and has one child. For six years, she has been running a hairdressing business in the Adidogomé neighbourhood, where she lives.

As her customer base is growing and the amount of supplies she needs means she has to restock at least twice a week, Faustine is requesting a loan to purchase two dozen sets of hair extensions and weaves. 

The income from Faustine's business will enable her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dozen sets of hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita, who is a rice farmer, and her family got support in financing their everyday needs. She is married and has three children. She plants and harvests rice to sell. 

Being in the business for over 10 years is quite good enough, but the minimum net income of PHP15,000 every cropping (twice a year) is not good.  In this regard, Renita is asking for a loan to invest further in her farming business, so that her yield on the next cropping will be greater. She will buy farm inputs like rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. 

Someday, she hopes to achieve a better harvest and good sales for the overall welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive en casa propia con su esposo  y su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas,   tiene buenas referencias de parte de sus vecinos,  además es una mujer muy trabajadora, responsable en sus tareas y sus labores  por su  gran amabilidad en su negocio es  como ha logrado tener una muy buena demanda de clientes, y es de esa manera como ella solventa algunos de sus gastos familiares,  la clienta solicita un crédito  para  realizar la compra de lo que es material de trabajo como: maíz por mayor y cal esto con el fin incrementar sus ingresos y su estabilidad económica y así poder alcanzar una calidad de vida.
texts.en: The borrower lives in her own house with her husband and son. She runs a business selling tortillas. She has good references from her neighbours and is a hardworking and responsible woman. She has a high level of demand among her customers thanks to her friendly service, and this is how she is able to pay some of the household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs for her work, including wholesale corn and lime, with the aim of increasing her earnings and improving her economic stability and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime

loans.name: Napié

texts.fr:
Napié réside dans le quartier Vakpossito avec ses 5 enfants.
Elle a commencé à son domicile le commerce des produits alimentaires depuis 10 ans et la restauration de la bouillie. 
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bassar et à Adjengré, villages qui se trouvent à environ 400 km de Lomé.
Ce micro crédit lui sera nécessaire  pour acheter 01 sac de maïs et 30 tubercules d‘igname.
Les bénéfices lui permettront de contribuer  à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: Napié lives in the Vakpossito quarter with her five children. She started a food products business and corn porridge restaurant from her home ten years ago. She stocks up once a week at Bassar and Adjengré, villages that are found around 400 km from Lomé. This micro credit is necessary for her to buy one bag of corn and thirty yam tubers. The profits will allow her to contribute to the flourishment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase one bag of corn and 30 yam tubers.

loans.name: Phinoy

texts.en:
Phinoy, pictured here, is 29 years old and single. He lives with his sister in a Phnom Penh suburb. Phinoy has full-time employment in a company. 

Phinoy is requesting a loan to attend a video editing class. When he completes the class, he plans to run his own video production business.

loans.use: to attend a video editing class

loans.name: Sinazima

texts.fr:
Agée de 42 ans, Sinazima est une jeune femme très active qui mène son commerce ambulant des œufs frais depuis 2001. Elle est mariée et a 03 enfants. Elle réside dans le quartier Agoè à Lomé.

Elle s’approvisionne à la ferme d’Adétikopé et les revend à domicile et  à la criée dans les quartiers voisins.
Ce micro crédit est sollicité pour acheter 30 plateaux d’œuf frais pour augmenter ses revenus et contribuer à l’épanouissement de sa famille.
texts.en: 42 years old, Sinazima is a very active young woman who has run a traveling business selling fresh eggs since 2001. She is married and has three children. She lives in the Agoè quarter in Lomé. She stocks up at the farm in Adétikopé and resells from her home and by hawking her wares in neighboring parts of town. This micro credit is requested to buy 30 trays of fresh eggs to increase her revenues and contribute to the flourishment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 30 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida lives in Amulung with her spouse and two children. To earn income, she manages a store selling various groceries. She usually gets an income  of PHP 300 net each day and uses it for the daily school allowance of her children. She hopes to increase her income. That is why she is borrowing a loan from lenders to buy canned goods, bread, noodles, and more to sell. In the future, this additional business capital (if granted) will help her save funds for the future expenses of her family through sales.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, bread, noodles, and more to sell

loans.name: Amanat

texts.en:
Amanat is a 50-year-old married man. He is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with his family. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife. Since 1992, Amanat has been in the business of selling milk, which is the only source of income for the family. He has four buffaloes for this work. He sells their milk door to door and in the main market. By doing so he generates income to fulfill his family's needs. His net income is not enough to cope with the daily and monthly needs of his family. He has lots and lots of expenses to pay for. Like electricity bills, gas and water bills, children's school fees, food expenses, and also buffalo-keeping and their food expenses. So he is planning to purchase one more buffalo so that he will have more milk to sell. 

However due to financial constraints, he finds it difficult. Therefore he has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. He wishes to provide all facilities of life to his children. He is feeling excited and relaxed after taking a loan.

loans.use: to purchase buffalo to sell milk

loans.name: Otunoy

texts.ru: Отуной 43 года. Она замужем за образованного человека. Ее муж Миршариф работает преподавателем. Отуной работает преподавателем в Худжандском Государственном Университете. Она умная и опытная преподавательница. Отуной должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, так как ее сын в этом году поступил в университет. Отуной запрашивает займ на сумму 650 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора своего сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Otunoy is 43 years old.  She is married to an educated person.  Her husband, Mirsharif, works as a teacher.  Otunoy works as a teacher at the Khujand State University.  She is a smart and experienced teacher.  Otunoy has to pay for her son's tuition contract because her son got accepted to a university this year.  Otunoy is requesting a loan in the amount of 650 US dollars to pay for her son's university tuition.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition

loans.name: Laiheang

texts.en:
Laiheang, pictured here, lives with her sister and widowed mother in a suburb of Phnom Penh. She has just finished her first year at an accounting institute on Phnom Penh and will start her second year soon. In Cambodia, bachelor degree study consists of four years that are divided into two semesters each year. Students can pay school fees yearly or by the semester depending on the school or university policy.  

Laiheang is requesting her second loan to pay her upcoming school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Saravuth

texts.en:
Saravuth, pictured here, is 21 and single. He lives with his parents, brother, and sister in a village approximately 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Saravuth is an English student at the Institute of Foreign Language in Phnom Penh and is also an English teacher for a private school. He has finished the third year and second semester of his studies and will soon enter his fourth year. 

Saravuth is requesting a loan to continue his studies and pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Anvarjon

texts.ru:
Анварчон житель города Худжанд. Он живет с матерью и дедушкой потому что недавно умер его отец. У Анварчона имеется среднее образование. Он недавно окончил школу с хорошими оценками. Анварчон ответственный и способный мальчик. Он два года как работает мастером-обдельщиком. Он в основном переделывает мебель. Изучил эту деятельность он у своего дяди. Именно с ним Анварчон работает в этой области. 
Анварчон поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Он просит кредит для оплаты договора за первый год обучения в университете, чтобы начать учебу. Его дедушка будет помогать ему оплачивать сумму займа в будущем. Анварчон будет работать в свободное время.
texts.en: Anvarjon is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He lives with his mother and grandfather because his father recently passed away.  Anvarjon has a secondary education.  He recently graduated from school with good grades.  Anvarjon is a responsible and capable boy.  He has been working as a master-upholsterer for two years.  He primarily reconditions furniture.  He learned this trade from his uncle.  Anvarjon works with him in this field.  Anvarjon was accepted to the Tajikistan State Commerce University.  He is requesting this loan to pay for his first year tuition in the university in order to start his studies.  His grandfather will help him to repay the loan amount in the future.  Anvarjon will work in his free time.

loans.use: to pay for his first year tuition in the university in order to obtain higher education

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for labor.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which has a scarcity of available land. He has 10 children and has been doing this work for 6 years. His primary income sources are milk, crops, transportation services, and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Dairy farming.' His biggest challenge is 'climate changes affecting crops.' An animal on the farm has been given the name 'Mitchel.'

John was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'he was interested in dairy farming.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'The funds given if used properly make payment easier.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, John replied it will improve income and quality of life.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. John owns the following: a cow, poultry, a pump, bicycle, and motorcycle, but does not own a pig or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, TV, and DVD but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, or a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Raweltaaba Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU représente le groupe RAWELTAABA. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge. 
Mme vend du Zoom Kom (jus local) depuis 04ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Watinooma. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de petit mil et 01sac de sucre pour la préparation du Zoom Kom (jus local).
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices afin de s’acquérir d’une motocyclette. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et  scolariser d’avantage ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Habibou represents the Raweltaaba group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of six. Her eldest child is 25 years of age, and her youngest child is five. Three of her children are in school. She has three dependents. She has been selling “zoom kom” (local beverage) for four years. She stocks up in Watinooma. Her clients are local men and women.

She would like to buy two bags of pearl millet and one bag of sugar to prepare the “zoom kom” beverage. She would like to save her earnings in order to be able to buy a motorbike. Her goal is to expand her business and provide

loans.use: to buy two bags of pearl millet and one bag of sugar to prepare the “zoom kom” beverage.

loans.name: Mahmadnazar

texts.ru: Махмадназар 38-летний женатый человек, проживающий в городе Куляб в южной части Таджикистана. У Махмадназара 3 сына и 2 дочери. Махмадназар со своей женой - Давлатби прошли через многое. И следующие планы, которые они строят, тоже нелегкий. Махмадназар решил открыть свою собственную мастерскую по ремонту автомашин. Так как последние несколько лет он работал в автосервисе, он приобрел достаточный опыт и теперь хочет начать собственный бизнес в этой сфере. Единственная преграда для реализации его планов это нехватка финансов. Махмадназар на свои сбережения рядом с домом построил помещение размером 12х6 метра с жженого кирпича для открытия мастерской. Сейчас у него на руках осталось 400 долларов. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом в размере 1500 долларов США, чтобы купить запасные части автомашин и наконец начать свой бизнес по ремонту машин.
texts.en: Mahmadnazar is a 38 year-old married man, living in the city of Kulob in the southern part of Tajikistan.  He has three sons and two daughters.  Mahmadnazar and his wife, Davlatbi, went through a lot.  And their next plans are also not easy to accomplish.  Mahmadnazar decided to open his own shop to repair cars.  Because he spent several years working at an auto service, he obtained sufficient experience and now want to open his own business in this field.  The only barrier to realizing his plans is the lack of money.  Mahmadnazar used his savings to build a 12x6 meter space near his house with burnt brick to open the shop.  Now he has 400 dollars remaining.  This is why he is requesting a loan in the amount of 1500 US dollars to buy spare parts for cars and finally start his own auto repair business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cars and start his own auto repair business

loans.name: Vichheka

texts.en: Vichheka (in the photo), 20 years old, is single. He lives with his sister in a Phnom Penh suburb. He is now in his first year and first semester of his Bachelor's degree, majoring in nursing.  He will start the second semester of his first year soon. Hence, Vichheka decided to apply for a Kiva loan.  The loan will be used to prepay for the second semester of his first and first semester of his second year.  In Cambodia there are four years divided into two semesters each year.    Students can pay school fees by the year or by semester, depending on school or university privacy policy.

loans.use: To pay for school fees.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es: Estrella, de 54 años, es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus 2 hijos: Wilfredo y Yamileth, a los que cuida en la casa que compró hace 10 años. Su actividad económica por 20 años, es la venta de carne. Cuenta que su trabajo consiste en la compra de ganado porcino en cantidad, sobre todo los de mayor peso y en estado saludable. Después de adquirirlos, los mata para vender la carne en ferias regionales y de los distritos. Con ellos obtiene buenas ganancias, además aprovecha el puesto que tiene para vender productos de belleza a los clientes que ya la conocen. Le va muy bien en su negocio, “vendo más cantidad de carne en las festividades”, afirma. Hace poco, pintó el ambiente donde abrirá su Chicharronería (lugar donde se vende platos a base de carne de cerdo), donde podrá obtener más ganancias, pues obtendrá la carne de cerdo y ella misma podrá utilizarlo para la elaboración de sus platos. Ya comenzó a trabajar y le va muy bien, ya que se ubica en una zona comercial. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Estrella, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de carne de cerdo, que le sirve como insumo para su negocio.
texts.en: Estrella, 54, is a simple woman. She lives with her two children, Wilfredo and Yamileth, in the house she bought 10 years ago. For the last 20 years she has worked selling meat. She says that her job consists of buying pigs, particularly those which are heavy and healthy, which she then slaughters to sell the meat at local fairs. This brings in a good income, and she uses her good standing with customers to also sell beauty products. Things are going well for her, and she says that she sells more meat at festivals. A little while ago, she found a place to open her own chicharroneria (restaurant selling pork dishes), which will allow her to earn more money as she will be sourcing and preparing the meat herself. Business has been good, as the restaurant is located in a commercial district. This is her sixth loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to be able to get ahead. She promises to make her repayments in a timely manner. Estrella will invest the 2,500 sols in buying pork to stock up her business.

loans.use: to buy pork.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 60 years old. She is married to a tricycle driver and the couple has two children. For almost the past five years, Severina has been raising hogs. She earns a 3,000 PHP profit for each hog that she sells. 

Severina is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase feed for her hogs as she has insufficient funds. She hopes that her business will continue to expand so that she can earn more income to benefit her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her hogs

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has three children. She lives in the Kisii area of Kenya which does not have much available land. For the past three years, Eunice has been a farmer. She finds farming maize and dairy-keeping to be the most enjoyable parts of farming and her biggest challenge is the lack of quality seeds and farming equipment. Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Nyaringa.” When asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan, Eunice replied, “because of the low interest rate.” When she took a required microfinance session, she learned that Juhudi issues loans to groups. Eunice’s highest monthly expense is school fees and she plans to use the profit from her loan to benefit her family by helping to pay school fees. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Eunice owns cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. She has a household mosquito net and sewing machine, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a TV or DVD. 

Eunice is requesting a loan to buy a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi and her husband are blessed with one child and they live happily in the village of Mabbayad. She is requesting a loan from lenders to purchase feed and an additional piglet to grow her hog-raising business. Her goal is to expand the business and will greatly support her family needs if given the chance. Noemi said to herself that she must be strong and work harder in order to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase feed and an additional piglet to grow her hog-raising as a chosen business.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 31 years old and married to Antonio, a farmer in their village. They have been blessed with three children. 

Jenalyn has had a retailing business for two years. In this business she is earning an average net income of 300 PHP each day. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase various grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and more biscuits to sell. 

She is hoping that this loan will be granted so her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase various grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and more biscuits to sell

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Rafael lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is primarily a banana and sugar cane growing region. He has 6 children and has been doing this work for 30 years. His primary income sources are crops and personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Crop and dairy farming!' His biggest challenge is 'lack of capital.' Animals on the farm have been given the names Ruto, and Ngilu.

Rafael was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Because they offer farming loans.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That recordkeeping is very important for a group to survive.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Rafael replied 'They will have milk for consumption and sale to substitute his income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Rafael owns the following: a cow, poultry, and a bicycle but does not own a pig, pump, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and TV but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, or a DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 47-year-old lady living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her four daughters and a son. She knits handmade embroidery with her daughters.
