Asia and her daughters are doing a lot of hard work to cover household expenses. Her son sells the handmade embroidery in nearby markets at different rates. Now their mutual business is growing and they need to invest more capital but they do not have enough savings to grow their business. 

Therefore, Asia requested a loan so that she could buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She will save the profit amount; she wants to arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters but is unable to, due to savings. 

Asia says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda, 32 years old, is married and blessed with five children. To earn a living, Brenda is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been two years doing this business and usually, she earns about 2,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) per grown up pigs when sold. She wants to have more piglets to raise and in this regard, she is asking for a loan to buy additional hogs to raise, and hog feed for them.  Brenda hopes to sustain the needs of her hogs as well as her family's daily needs. She is working hard towards the attainment of her goal.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise, and hog feed.

loans.name: Alban

texts.en:
Alban lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which has a scarcity of available land. He has three children and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income source is milk.  He stated what is most enjoyable about farming, 'Weeding!'  His biggest challenge is 'Climate change.'  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyota.'

Alban was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Better services.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Low interest rate.'  His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family?', Alban replied, 'Milk and manure.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Alban owns the following: 'cow' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net', but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is an area that does not suffer from a dry season. He has six children. His primary income sources are milk and eggs; he has been doing this work for five years.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming is 'growing crops and rearing livestock.' His biggest challenge is 'diseases.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Nyabarati.'

Thomas was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'low interest rate.' This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: 'better services.'

His highest monthly expense is business related. When asked 'How will this loan benefit his family', Thomas replied 'milk and manure.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Thomas owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kubra

texts.en:
Kubra is 43-year-old lady who lives with her 3 sons and a daughter. She owns a general store at home. She has allotted a part of her house for the store. One of her drawing rooms opens to the front side of the street, so she is using that room for her general store. She offers many items such as rice, flour, pulses (peas & beans), sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She has been running this business for many years and this is the major source of income for her family, because her husband does not come back home for many days. 

Now she wants to expand her business with the growth of the needs of her family. After she decided to grow her business, she came to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for a loan. She will buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. She hopes that her general store will work better than before. Kubra praises this partnership and says thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy general store items such as more stock of rice, pulses, flour, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits.

loans.name: Rubeena's Group

texts.en:
Rubeena is a 27-year-old lady.  She is the mother of two daughters and a son. Her husband owns a workshop in which he provides the services to maintain the buses.  He is professional in his techniques and can easily fix the problem of engines in no time. He has to use various types of tools for the maintenance of buses. A few days ago, he shifted his workshop to another place.  During shifting, some important and expensive tools such as Philips screw driver, flat blade screw drivers, a drill machine, pliers, socket & ratchet set, heat gun, try square, G clamp, hammer, etc., were lost.  Rubeena requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to compensate against this loss. 

Rubeena wants to provide a better education and living standard to her children. She is hopeful that her husband will utilize this amount in a positive way and his monthly income will increase.  Rubeena says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy tools to provide services to fix the problem of buses.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодира живет и работает в Турсунзаде. Там же у нее муж и дети. Ее дети учатся в средней школе. Дочке 16 лет, двум мальчикам по 13 и 10 лет. Все они ходят в школу.  Муж Нодиры работает продавцом на рынке. Самой Нодире 39 лет. Она работает учительницей в школе. Одновременно она успевает и заняться домашним хозяйством и работой на земле. Нодира вот уже 3 года как занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Работа на земле не легкий труд, но Нодира не боится трудностей и дети ей помогают. Для того чтобы получить качественный урожай нужны минеральные удобрения, однако чтобы их купить ей не хватает средств. Поэтому Нодира обратилась за кредитом и ожидает поддержки.
texts.en: Nodira lives and works in Tursunzade with her husband and children. Her children are in secondary school. Her daughter is 16 years old, and her sons are 13 and 10. All go to school. Nodira’s husband works as a vendor at the marketplace. Nodira is 39 years old. She works as a school teacher. At the same time, she manages to take care of the household and do some farming. For three years, Nodira has been growing agricultural produce. Farming is hard work, but Nadira is not afraid of difficulties, and her children help her. In order to harvest quality produce, mineral fertilizers are needed, but she lacks the means to buy them. This is  why Nodira has applied for a loan and is looking forward to your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Vepkhvia

texts.en:
Vepkhvia is 48 years old. He lives in a small village of the Zestaponi district with his son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Vepkhvia is actively involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a vineyard and a plot of agricultural land where 100 nut trees are grown. He works hard and always has high quality products which are sold at a good price at local markets. 

As the income is only seasonal, Vepkhvia decided to get a loan and start his own business, so he sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The Startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. 

Vepkhvia's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the received credit he plans to open a food market. He already owns a commercial space, but needs to buy inventory. When the market is opened he will have a stable income and will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and open a food market.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika is from Kutaisi town where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children. She is 24 years old and earns a living through clothing sales. Specifically, she gets apparel from the local retailers and sells for a profit among her community members. Since there are not many clothing stores Veronika's business has high demand. She is very nice to her customers and does her job with love and care. 

She has applied for this loan in order to purchase a supply of clothing at wholesale prices in Turkey and continue her business. Veronika will be able to get more profit and make savings to satisfy the everyday needs of her family members. She awaits your generosity

loans.use: to pay for clothing to sell to customers.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal was born in 1967. She lives in a rented house with her husband and two daughters.

One of her daughters is studying for a Bachelor of Business Administration, and is in her third year. Amal and her husband are facing a financial crisis during this period which does not allow them to pay for their daughter's study fees. 

Her daughter hopes to finish her studies to work in her study field after graduation to help her family financially.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's study fees

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 32-year-old lady living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides a service of dent repair and painting at the front of an auto repair shop; he does not have a proper place or workshop to enhance his abilities.  He fills just minor dents and scratches on vehicles; if he found abnormal damage, he does not have a sufficient stock of paint and putty for filling dents.
.
Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband could establish his business and could easily buy filling material. 

Her dream is to buy a proper workshop for her husband so that he could easily attract more customers for services. 

Farzana hopes that her husband will not fail to provide services for abnormal dents.  

She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy putty to fill dents and cans of paints for vehicles.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman and has 2 children. She describes herself to be motivated. She operates a cereals store where she sells maize, beans, peas etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area that is good for business and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase cereal stock for resale. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will succeed. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase cereal stock for resale

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Doña Antonia, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, tiene un hijo y vive sola con su esposo en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de leña, bloques y cría y engorde de cerdos para la venta.  Estos productos como la leña y los bloques los compra y los revende en la  misma comunidad, al igual que los cerdos, los cuales engorda y los vende. Lleva dos ciclos de prestamos en ODEF con el actual que es por 5,000  Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de cerdos para engorde y venta. esta inversión la hace con el propósito de aprovechar la temporada buena  de venta al fin de año y navidad. Su plan es ahorrar para el futuro.
texts.en:
Antonia is 38 years old, married, and has a son. She and her husband live alone in the municipality of Arizona, Atlantida. For 3 years now, she has been selling firewood and blocks, plus raising and fattening pigs to sell. The firewood and blocks she purchases and re-sells in her community, as she does also with the pigs she fattens and sells. 

Antonia is in her 2nd cycle of loans with ODEF, including the present loan which is for 5,000 lempiras. She invests these loans in the purchase of pigs to fatten and sell. She is making this investment hoping to take advantage of the good sales season at the end of the year around Christmas. Her plan is to save for the future.

loans.use: buy pigs to fatten and sell around Christmas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel, aged 35, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children. She has been managing a vegetable vending business for almost 3 years. In this business she's earning a net income of about Php 150 per day. Due to insufficient funds she wanted to ask for a loan amounting to Php 13,000 to purchase eggplant, string beans, squash, and onions to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it immediately on her vegetable vending business and earn more profits as well.

loans.use: To purchase eggplant, string beans, squash, and onions to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be highly motivated. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes and then sells them. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area that is smart for the business, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs. His business goal is to own a big shop within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed in life and in business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 50 years old and widowed. She is the mother of 4 daughters and 2 sons. Her daughters have gotten married and are happily living in their own homes. Both of her sons look after the whole activity of the house. One son is settled and earning a good income, but the younger one could not establish his business yet. He recently started a cot knitting and selling business. He buys iron cot frames from the market, knits the cots and then sells to the customers. 

Nasreen wants her son to get a better income so that he would be able to support his family alone. Therefore she requested a loan for her son so that he could buy iron cot frames to sell. Nasreen says thank you to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for knitting cots to sell.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa is 34 years old. She lives with her parents and 5 siblings. One of her brothers works at a private company. Haifa works as a teacher and is in her 1st year studying for a Bachelor of History at the same time. Her aim is to work in her field after she graduates. Haifa's parents are not able to pay for her upcoming semester fees and to buy her the necessary books as they are facing financial crisis. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ellen works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from charcoal retail.  Ellen is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

Ellen has been sustaining her business activities through a previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Nema

texts.en: Nema was born in 1971. She is a mother of six. Her husband is retired. One of her sons is studying for his Bachelor of Art Education; he is in his first year. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation. Nema is asking for this loan to pay for his study fees to help him get closer to reaching his goal. She and her husband don't have enough money to pay the school fees during this period.

loans.use: To pay for her son's school fees

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel is 49 years old, married, and has six children. He has operated a business raising hogs and poultry for over eight years and is able to meet the necessities of his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase feed, vitamins and medicines for his hog and poultry business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his income and his family's living status.

loans.use: purchase feed, vitamins and medicines for his hog and poultry business.

loans.name: May Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy believes in this quotation: Poverty is not a hindrance to success. She believes that all things happen for a purpose, and she considers poverty as a challenge. Mary Joy is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She manages a retail store where she sells different commodities. She is new in this type of business.

She wanted to expand her product offerings, but she does not have enough capital to do that. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy drinks, canned goods, noodles, and powdered milk to sell. Mary Joy hopes to earn a higher income as a result of offering more products.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, noodles, and powdered milk to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a greengrocery stall where she sells green vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a town center and her primary customers are retailers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that dry seasons are problematic. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more green vegetables for resale. Her business goal is to open a greengrocery store within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is Susan's third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel is 48 years old and married with nine children, three of whom are in school. Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc. She has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from fishing and raising pigs. Raquel aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of items to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rehab

texts.en: Rehab is 22 years old. She lives with her parents and five siblings. Rehab is currently studying for a diploma in children's education and is in her second year. She is planning to continue her studies toward a bachelor's degree. Rehab is facing problems with paying her fees which are expensive. For this reason, she applied for this loan to pay them. As Rehab is a conservative person, she asked her mother to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: To pay for her study fees

loans.name: Chirel

texts.en:
Chirel is 34 years old and married with two children.

Chirel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack food, canned goods, vegetables and other groceries.

Chirel has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from electronic mobile loading.

Chirel aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack food, canned goods, vegetables and other groceries.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 22 years old and living in the small town of Chokhatauri. He is single and living with his parents. The only one who makes money in the household is David’s father, working for a local municipality as an economist. He gets a small monthly salary to cover food and daily expenditures. David is a very energetic and enthusiastic young man with a great desire to get ahead. 

He is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering him since, thanks to their help, he will be able to purchase all the needed materials for greenhouse construction. He plans to grow mushrooms there and sell the harvest at the local open market. Thanks to this loan, he will improve the quality of life and increase family income. His goal is to provide his family with better living conditions and be financially independent.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse and grow mushrooms there.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a coffee grains  business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase seven sacks of harvested coffee grains for sale.She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of harvested coffee nuts.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana hace un año consiguió fortalecer su negocio con la ayuda de financiamiento que obtuvo en Fundación Alternativa gracias a los inversionistas del portal de Kiva. Ahora ha ganado mayor expriencia y su expectativa futura es poder estudiar en la universidad y obtener un título profesional relacionado con la agricultura y la administración, algo como Ingeniería Agroindustrial con lo que pueda seguir ejerciendo el negocio que ha aprendido desde muy niña. 
Ahora requiere un prestamo para aumentar y renovar su ganado lo que le generará mayor producción de leche que podrá repartir en los alrededores de su comunidad y de la ciudad. 
Diana espera que los inversionistas de Kiva le brinden el apoyo para que ella pueda obtener los ingresos suficientes para un día poder cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
A year ago, Diana was able to strengthen her business with financing help she obtained from Fundación Alternativa thanks to Kiva lenders. Now she has gained more experience and her expectation for the future is to attend university and obtain a professional degree in something related to agriculture and administration like Agroindustrial Engineering, so that she can continue working in the business she started learning as a very young child.

Now she is requesting a loan in order to increase and replenish her cattle, which will generate higher milk production for her to deliver in the surrounding areas of her community and in the city. 
 
Diana hopes that Kiva lenders will offer her the support she needs in order to obtain enough income for her to one day make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en:
Etibar is a married man who is 30 years old and has one child - a 10-year-old who is in school. For 12 years, Etibar has worked selling dairy products, cattle and caring for livestock. Previously he worked in the agricultural sector. 

The loan that he is asking for is to buy a cow which will improve his life and his business since he will have more milk products to sell and be able to better support his family. He needs to be able to improve his child's diet as his health requires.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ludy works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling frozen products in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Ludy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods to sell.

Ludy has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and has one child. He describes himself to be self motivated. He operates a retail store where he sells basins. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a town center and his primary customers are retailers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds to boost business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more basins for resale. His business goal is to succeed within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a happy and healthy life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more basins for resale

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amelia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Amelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of items to sell, like canned goods, milk, noodles, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 30-year-old single mother of two children living in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling fresh foods for a year. She also farms to earn extra income. She started the business in order to raise money to educate her children. The high rate of perishability and inadequate capital affect her business growth. Her dreams are to have a quality food store with refrigerators and to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualification. Everlyne intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Silah

texts.en: Silah is a 47-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be highly self-motivated. He operates a transportation service where he transports customers and packages. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area good for business, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough money. He will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy spare parts to service the motorbike. His business goal is to own at least four motorbikes within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will succeed in life. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy spare parts to service his motorbike

loans.name: Gecelle

texts.en:
Gecelle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers. Gecelle has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Gecelle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mutasem

texts.en: Mutasem is 21 years old. He lives with his parents and 5 siblings. One of his brothers is a teacher. Mutasem is currently in his 3rd year of studying for a Bachelor degree in Accounting. He is planning to work in his field of study after graduation. Now he is applying for a loan to be able to pay his college fees, as his family is facing financial problems which do not help them in covering their needs.

loans.use: To pay his college fees.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
A $ 1,000 loan is offered to Maria to improve her business. She opened her garden in 2008 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep up her garden like a shovel, crowbar, seeds, hose, dipper, and bucket. She is generating a good income from selling.
She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family, and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy shovel, crowbar, seed, hose, dipper and bucket,

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Ameyo est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 03 de ses derniers sont scolarises. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint, elle a démarré la vente des produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2002.  Son prêt lui servira d’acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins de la famille. Le profit lui permettra d’assurer le bien – être de la famille. Elle est agée de 40ans.
texts.en: Ameyo is married and the mother of four children. She began selling food products in 2002 in order to lend a hand to her spouse. Her loan will help her buy goods so that she can meet the needs of her family. The profit will allow her to ensure the well-being of her family. She is 40 years old.

loans.use: buy food products.

loans.name: Naomi's Group

texts.en:
Naomi's group is beginning its sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana to support their business capital so that they can eventually grow their businesses. It is made up of seven members and is led by Naomi. The businesses operated by the members of this group include selling fresh fish, foodstuff (yam, cassava, vegetables), provisions (Milo, cerelac, oveltine, sugar, etc.) and rice.

The loan for which they are applying will benefit small enterprises such as Naomi's business. She says that she has been with ID-Ghana for five loan cycles, joining on the invitation of a credit officer of the institution who came to visit her in her home. Currently, she has a business supplying fresh fish. This is a business she inherited from her mother, who worked in the same field. Naomi is standing on the far right in the photograph.

Naomi is requesting a loan amount of GHS 1,000 to buy and supply fresh fish to customers. She will acquire from the fishing harbor in Tema, Ghana. This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as quickly as possible, since her husband is unemployed now and her two children are of school-going ages.

loans.use: to buy and supply fresh fish to customers.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, de 47 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Cuando era muy joven comenzó a trabajar en diferentes actividades, pues tenía que sacar adelante a sus hijos. Fue entonces que comenzó a forjar su camino, su principal cualidad es la cocina; por ello pensó en aprovechar su talento y abrir un restaurante. Poco a poco, compró lo necesario para encaminar su negocio. Al principio fue difícil, pero ahora cuenta con una cocina industrial y un local equipado, todo ello gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Tiene gran clientela, pues la zona donde se encuentra es comercial y hay afluencia de personas, sobre todo los fines de semana; en la feria que se realiza. Ahora ella espera mejorar los platos que sirve, para tener mayor clientela y mejores ganancias. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Marina, invertirá los S/.1700 en la compra de arroz, verduras y carnes para poder preparar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Marina, 47, is single mother of three children but only two of them still live with her in a house of her own.  When she was very young she started working in various activities because she needed to support her children.  That was when she started to carve out her path.  

Her main skill is cooking so she decided to avail herself of her talent and open a restaurant.  She gradually purchased what was needed to start her business.  It was difficult at the beginning but she now has an industrial stove and a well-equipped locale.  All of this is thanks to her effort and dedication.  

She has a large clientele because the zone she’s located in is commercial and there are many passers-by, especially on weekends when the street market takes place.  Now, she hopes to improve the dishes she serves to increase her clientele and improve profits.  

This is her 6th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward.  She also commits to make her payments punctually.  Marina will use the 1,700 soles to buy rice, vegetables and meat to be able to prepare me dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Kangnigan

texts.fr: Kangnigan  âgé de 35ans pour aménager son atelier de coiffure et acheter une tondeuse à courant sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Il a démarré en 2000 et aidé par 02 personnes. Il espère ouvrir un second atelier et subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Marié, il est père de 03 enfants âgés de 07, 05 et 02ans. Les deux plus âgés sont scolarisés.
texts.en: Kangnigan is a 35-year-old married father of three children between the ages of 2 and 7. The two eldest are currently studying in school. Kangnigan is seeking his first loan from WAGES so that he can develop his hair salon and purchase electric clippers. His started this business in 2000 and is helped by two employees. He hopes to open a second salon and meet the needs of the family.

loans.use: to develop his hair salon and purchase electric clippers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 60 años es madre soltera de 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada desde hace muchos años. Gracias a su constancia, ella pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos. María trabaja en varias actividades. De lunes a viernes, vende ropa de toda variedad, color y tamaño a los pobladores de su zona. Su trabajo consiste en la venta de casa en casa, pues no cuenta con una tienda o lugar específico en donde la puedan encontrar; su secreto adicional; es vender la ropa en las ferias de las ciudades cercanas. Pero más adelante espera alquilar un espacio en la zona céntrica de la ciudad. Asimismo los fines de semana, vende mazamorra en la feria grande que se realiza en su ciudad, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Como sabe que todo esfuerzo es recompensado, continúa trabajando sin descanso, pues desea ver a sus hijos realizados y con aspiraciones. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “IDME” y este es su sexto crédito con Kiva, y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. María; invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de varios sacos de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
María, who is sixty years old, is a single mother of two children. She lives with them in a house they have been renting for many years. Thanks to her perseverance, she was able to raise her children.  

María works in several businesses. Monday through Friday, she sells clothing in different styles, colors, and sizes to residents in her area. She works selling her items door to door, because she doesn't have a store or a specific place where she can be found. Her additional secret is selling clothing in the markets of nearby towns. In the future she hopes to rent a space downtown. And on the weekends she sells corn pudding in the large local market, where she obtains extra income. Since she knows that all efforts are rewarded, she keeps working tirelessly, because she wants to see her children become fulfilled and have aspirations. 

She belongs to the communal bank IDME and this is her sixth loan through Kiva. She is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to move forward. She also promises to pay her installments on time. María will invest the 2,000 soles in purchasing several sacks of clothing for men, women, and children.

loans.use: to buy men, women, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: Susan, de 22 años; es una joven luchadora. Vive en compañía de su hermano en la casa de sus padres. Susan estudia ingeniería civil en una universidad reconocida, donde paga una mensualidad, por esa razón incursionó en el negocio de venta de productos para el hogar pero ahora su principal ingreso se centra en la venta de comidas y bebidas de todo tipo, en sociedad con su mamá que le ofreció un espacio de su casa, donde abre todos los domingos en la feria que se desarrolla en la calle que da a su casa, por lo que está obteniendo muchas ganancias, ya que es concurrida. Desea mejorar las ganancias que percibe, pues desea culminar sus estudios y comenzar nuevos proyecto, sabe que para lograrlo necesita un buen capital de dinero, que está segura de ahorrar. Este es su sexto crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Susan; invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de ingredientes tales como arroz, carnes , verduras y varias cajas de bebidas de diferentes marcas.
texts.en:
Susan, 22, is a young warrior.  She lives with her brother in her parents’ house.  Susan’s studying Civil Engineering at a renowned university where she pays monthly tuition.  Because of this she decided to go into business selling household goods but now her main source of income is selling food and all types of beverages in partnership with her mother who gave her space at home to set up a stand facing their street on Sundays.  She’s earning high profits because it’s very popular.

She wants to improve the profits she earns because she wants to complete her studies and start new projects.  She knows that in order to do so she needs a good amount of capital that she’s sure she will be able to save up.

This is her 6th Kiva loan and she feels grateful for the financial support she gets to continue forward; she also commits to make her payments punctually.

Susan will use the 2,000 soles to buy ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables and several cases of beverages in assorted brands.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, meat, vegetables and several assorted cases of beverages.

loans.name: Hodabalo

texts.fr:
Hodabalo réside dans le quartier  Adidogomé avec sa femme. Il a 28 ans et a ouvert un atelier de coiffeur à domicile.
Il est dynamique et sait attirer la clientèle grâce aux notions gestion acquises auprès des agents d’Assilassimé.
Ce micro crédit sollicité lui permettra d’acheter un fauteuil, une tondeuse et un ventilateur pour être plus performant dans son activité. Avec ce renouvellement de ses matériels, Hodabalo pense attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
Hodabalo lives in the Adidogomé neighbourhood with his wife.  He is 28 years old and has opened a barber shop from home.

Hodabalo is a dynamic businessman and knows how to attract customers thanks to the management advice given to him by the Assilassimé staff.

The micro-loan requested will help him buy a chair, clippers and a fan in order to carry out his work more effectively. With this new equipment, Hodabalo believes he can attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a chair, clippers and a fan.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza de 31 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica la venta de comida y además posee una tienda desde hace varios años sus negocios están ubicados en su domicilio, ella  es una persona mable, responsable, educada y con muy buen carácter, gracias a ello se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes que la prefieren ya que posee una clientela establecida, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gasto, Doña Esperanza solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de productos para elaborar la comida como pollos, carnes, verduras, arroz, frutas, etc. y también para surtir su tienda, y asi abastecer la demanda que posee, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 31, lives in a house of her own with her life companion and their two children.  She works selling food and also owns a store; both of her businesses have been home-based for many years.

She’s a kind, responsible, courteous woman with a very pleasant personality.  Thanks to this she’s won over her customers’ trust and they prefer her; she now has a well-established regular clientele as a result and is able this way to cover many of her costs.

Esperanza’s asking for a loan to buy products like chicken, meat, vegetables, rice, fruit, etc. that she uses to prepare her meals as well as to stock her store so that she can supply the current demand she has, to earn higher income and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, rice, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Las Palomitas Group

texts.es: Aida tiene 46 años es conviviente con un hijo dependiente hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y a la vez vende repuesto de carros hace 25 años. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de más productos naturales. Su mayor deseo en abrir un puesto de medicinas naturales. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Aida es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste polo fucsia.
texts.en:
Aida, 46, has a spouse and a dependent son.  She’s been selling natural remedies for ten years and for the last 25 years has also sold auto parts.  She will use the loan to buy more natural products. Her greatest wish is to open a natural remedies stand.  Aida is standing second from the right wearing a fuchsia shirt.

The group thanks Kiva lenders for the loan granted.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Mbene

texts.en: Mbene is a 42-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. For four years he has been working as a civil servant and also practices farming to earn extra income. A low salary and poor working conditions affect his plans of living a modest life while his desire is to build a permanent residence and educate his children up to the university. Mbene intends to use the loan to buy timber and iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.use: to buy timber and iron sheets to roof his house.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
María Magdalena es una joven de 28 años de edad madre de 1 hijo el cual es menor de edad. En compañía de su esposo se dedica a la agricultura ya que desde muy joven fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra siendo ellos agricultores desde toda un vida involucrándose en las diferentes actividades solo ellos dos como ser: Limpia, Poda, abona y Fertilización de las plantas de café. La tierra que cultivan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada aproximada mente a 10 kilómetros de su casa de habitación a la cual se trasladan a pie. Con un grado de educación secundaria ella es promotor en educación social y sus clientes son los diferentes compradores que en la temporada llegan a la zona para la adquisición del producto.

Ella ha solicitado a COMIXMUL un financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas como ser: 2 QQ de formula 
cafetalera, 5 QQ de fórmula de crecimiento, 3 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 3 QQ de urea para dar mantenimiento y asistencia técnica a sus cultivos de café.

Sus planes y metas son poder asistir a sus cultivos para evitar que la plantación se dañe y poder obtener una excelente cosecha la cual se pueda aprovechar al máximo sin dejar nada. Su sueño es poder darle una excelente educación a su hijo y poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
María Magdalena, 28, is a young mother of a minor son.  She and her husband work in agriculture since they learned this from their parents while still very young; her parents taught her to work the land since they had been farmers their entire lives.  They always carried out such tasks as: weeding, pruning and fertilizing the coffee plants.

The land they till is their own thanks to an inheritance from their parents; it’s located about 10 kilometers from home and they reach it on foot.  She completed secondary school and is a social worker and her main customers are seasonal buyers that come by the zone to buy the product.

She has asked Comixmul for a loan to buy agricultural supplies like 2 quintals of coffee formula, 5 quintals of growth, 3 quintals of formula 18-46-0 and 3 quintals of urea to provide maintenance and technical assistance to her coffee crop.

Her plans and goals are to be able to aide her crops to keep them safe from damage and to obtain an excellent crop yield that will be made use of to the maximum degree with no waste.  Her dream is to be able to provide her son with an excellent education and to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Lorens

texts.en:
Lorens is a 50-year-old man who is married to Yohana, a 39-year-old woman.  From their marriage they are blessed with 3 children. They are: Febri, 11 years old, in the 1st grade of junior high school; Musa, 9 years old; and Samuel, 8 years old.  Both Musa and Samuel are elementary school students.

Lorens is a newspaper peddler.  He has been running this business since 1998.  Every day he starts his business at 4 am by selling local and national newspapers in certain areas.  His income averages in the amount of IDR 20,000 – 70,000 each day.  In order to sell more newspapers he requested an individual loan in the amount of IDR 3,000,000 from TLM.  The loan will be spent to buy more newspapers and to pay his children's school fees as well.

loans.use: to buy more newspapers and to pay his children's school fees as well

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Luzminda works hard to support her family.  She buys and sells bananas in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables and a general store.  Luzminda is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional bananas for her business.  Luzminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old and is single with three children between the ages of 10 and 25. Two of her children are in school and live with her at home. Nancy lives in Tappita and describes herself as a businesswoman. Since 2001, she has been selling tea, bread, soap, biscuits, and other items. Nancy works six days a week and spends 15 hours each day at her business. She started her business with money she received from her mother and she learned her trade from friends. One of Nancy’s business challenges is the shortage of goods. 

Nancy is requesting a loan to purchase tea, bread, biscuits, soap and other items. She enjoys her flow of customers and plans to expand her business and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tea, bread, biscuits, soap and other items

loans.name: Muna

texts.en: Muna was born in 1964.  She is divorced and lives at a rented house with her son.  She works at a beauty salon trying her best to support herself and to cover her son's needs.  Muna's son is a first year student getting his Bachelor of Computer Engineering degree.  Muna doesn't have enough money to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Kwabene's Group

texts.en:
Kwabena's Group is composed of very dedicated women and a man, developing revenue-generating businesses. The women all live in the same neighborhood and have found out how to strengthen the group while developing their businesses. Their main work is in small-scale commerce.

Kwabena (standing on the left and the only male in the photograph) is the featured borrower in this group. He is 41 years old, married, and the father of two children (a boy and a girl). He buys plastic products, like ice chests, at a wholesale price at the central market and he resells to his customers in the community. 

With his new loan amount of GHS 600, Kwabena intends to purchase more plastic products, like ice chests, to sell to customers. 

In addition to bolstering his savings to obtain a bigger loan, he plans on supporting his children in their education.

The other members are Bernice, Charllote, Regina, and Theresah.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic products, like ice chests, to sell to customers.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.en:
Iskandar is 19 years old. He lives with his parents and three siblings. His father retired and is currently working at an engineering company. Iskandar is studying for a Bachelor of Plants Production, 2nd year. He is planning to work in his field after graduation to help his family improve their living conditions. 

As Iskandar currently doesn't have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Petrus

texts.en:
Petrus is a 31-year-old man who is married to Sarah, a 34-year-old woman. They live in a rented house with their children: Tania, 9 years old and Gerson, 6 years old. Both children are an elementary school students.
 
Petrus has been running a motorcycle repair business since 1999. He takes care of spark plug, oil and tire replacement, tire patching, tire air filling, and chain tuning. 

He used to run a poultry business, but the business went bankrupt. Presently, he decided to re-start his poultry business, but he lacks the money to do so. Therefore, he asked for an individual loan from TLM in the amount of IDR 3,000,000. He plans to buy a box of chicks, medicines, and a fodder. He hopes that the business will be successful in the future and will give a better life for his family

loans.use: to buy a box of chicks, medicines, and a fodder to start a poultry business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronics repair business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her electronic shop.

Vilma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her electronic business. NWTF is re-listing Vilma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her electronics.

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en: Jacquiline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a massage therapist business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase items like body lotion, oil, and towels.  Jacquiline has been in this business for three years.  Jacquiline has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items like body lotion, oil, and towels.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a hardworking man, age 43, with 4 children living in Hoima Uganda. He rears cattle, a business which he has run for over ten years now. He also earns additional income from a piggery project and operating a small retail shop. 

He dreams of expanding his livestock and educate his children to the university level despite inadequate capital that is affecting his business growth. Francis intends to use the loan to pay tuition fees for his son at the university.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his son at the university.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is repairing vehicles, as well as a transport business in order to support his growing family.

Customers not paying on time and inadequate capital affect his business plans. His dreams are to own a modern garage, to set up a hotel, and to expand his transport business.

Stephen is requesting a loan to buy a car spraying machine to use at the garage.

loans.use: to buy a car spraying machine to use at the garage.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is a 49-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda.  Ten years ago he decided to set up a retail shop in order to supplement his farming activities, which are seasonal and unpredictable.  Price fluctuations and unpredictable weather changes affect his projected profits.  His dream is to trade in wholesale, venture into modern farming, and pay school fees for his children.  Wilson intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Adama is 40 years old and married with three children ages 2 years, 7 years and 10 years. She runs a domestic product in Tombo in the Western Area Rural District in Sierra Leone. She's been in this business since before the war and sells glass cups, knives and food containers to her community. She says that the main problem with her business is an improper business location.

Adama requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 25 years old.  He is married and has 1 daughter.  Ali is in his third year of a Bachelor of Political Science program.  He also works as a police officer at the same time.  He is planning to work in his field after graduation, hoping that he will find a job with a better income that will help him cover his family needs.  Now he is facing financial problems which are not helping him in paying his upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, he applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 31 years old, married and lives in Compound #3 along with four children between two and fourteen years old. Three of the children are in school and all of them live at home. 

For six years, she has been selling fresh fish. She likes the way costumers respond to her business, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. Hannah is requesting a loan to buy more fresh fish for her business. In the future, she wants her children to attend university.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for her business,

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal was born in 1975.  She is married and has 4 children.  Her husband works at a private company.  Manal's daughter is a first year student in a Bachelor of Engineering program.  She is planning to work in her field after graduation and to start helping her family financially.  Manal and her husband don't have enough money to help their daughter pay her upcoming semester fees.  For this reason, she applied for this loan.  Because Manal is a conservative woman, she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's school fees

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en: Benedeta is a 49-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 12 years old. She describes herself as honest, responsible and goal oriented. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, soap, milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are middle class. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to add stocks of sugar, soap, milk and other items to improve business. Her business goal is to own a supermarket within 5 years where all goods will be available. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: purchase stocks of sugar, soap, milk and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of clothing and fabrics

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
Bebiana is 77 years old and married with 3 children.

Bebiana is in the agricultural businesses, farming corn, coconut and sugarcane in the Philippines. Bebiana requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bebiana has been farming corn for 46 years now, and earns additional income from a general store. She has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself as very aggressive. He operates a retail store where he sells bags. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a potential area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. 

Robert will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more bags for resale. His business goal is to be able to import bags to sell within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more bags for resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 42 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Agnes works very hard to provide for them.

Agnes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Agnes has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, bread, purified drinking water. 

In the future, Agnes would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Editha works very hard to provide for them.

Editha runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Editha has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, liquor, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize for resale.

loans.name: Rodolfo Francisco

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Milagro.  El cliente inició tiempo atrás con esta actividad cuando adquirió un taxi, el cual era un poco antiguo.  En la actualidad posee un vehículo del año.  Trabaja solo, todos los días de 6 am a 5 pm.  Es casado y su esposa es ama de casa.  Tiene hijos, quienes son todos mayores de edad.  Le gustaria en un futuro poder actualizar nuevamente su unidad.  Ahora necesita el crédito para invertir en la compra de medicina para tratamiento.
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Milagro.  Some time ago, he began his business when he acquired a used taxi.  Now he has a vehicle that is a newer model.  The borrower works alone every day from 6:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.  He is married and his spouse is a housewife.  They have children who are all grown.  In the future, he would like to upgrade his vehicle again.  

Now he needs a loan to invest in the purchase medicine for treatment.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 41 years old and married, with two children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from selling gasoline.

Marilyn aspires to save money to provide for the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 44-year-old hardworking man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling produce, as well as running a hotel.

The good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and set up more sustainable income generating activities to support them despite challenges of inadequate capital and price fluctuation. His business dream is to own a food store that can supply his customers all year round.

Hassan intends to use the loan to buy maize and rice to resell.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice to resell.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys used a previous loan to buy building materials and also to rent more decent premises for her restaurant business, so as to attract more customers. She is a 45-year-old, hard-working woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

Gladys has a number of businesses, which include poultry farming and a restaurant. With the proceeds, she has also been able to build a rental house to earn more income. She says that she is hindered by inadequate capital to realize all her dreams, while her plans are to expand her poultry project and venture into new markets, especially in the city.

Gladys intends to use this loan to buy poultry feed.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 34 years old. She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city of Buchanan are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. Anna lives in Buchanan City along with her husband and four children between the ages of 1 and 15, only three of whom are in school. Anna did not attend school. She has been selling pepper, oil, rice, salt, etc. for the past 10 years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of the goods mentioned above for her business. She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day  own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, oil, rice, salt, and other items for her business

loans.name: Soyjah

texts.en:
Please meet 37-year-old Soyjah from Buchanan.  Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
She did not go to school and she is married.  She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her spouse works as a security man.  They have four children between 14 and 23 years old, only three of whom are in school and live at home. 

Soyjah has a table business where she sells dry bush meat.  She has been in business for five years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours per day.  With this loan, she will buy more dry bush meat.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is limited income.  She transports her goods by shared taxi.  She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house.  She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more dry bush meat

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is 21 years old. She lives with her parents and 3 siblings. Fatmeh is in her fourth year of studying for a bachelor degree in childhood education. Her father is retired from military. Fatmeh is planning to open her own beauty salon in the future, after graduation. Her parents are currently facing financial problems, which are preventing them from paying for her student fees. For that reason, she applied for this loan to help her get one step closer to graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Changi Youth Group

texts.en:
Changi Youth Group was started in the year 2008 with an aim of empowering the young men of Shamata to be entrepreneurs. They had an agenda of helping each other start up small businesses so that by the time they marry they would be financially stable. Over that time they have been groomed to be disciplined and plan their lives while avoiding the reckless lifestyle lived by most young men.
Since Shamata is not connected to the electricity grid, the group saw an opportunity during one of VEPs promotional drives and decided to partner with VEP and establish themselves as a solar lamp supplier in that region. They plan to stock solar lamps that are accredited by Lighting Africa as quality, and  which are also supplied by VEP and hence have a sustainable business.
VEP has loaned them start-up capital and is also helping them in promotion and marketing.
It’s expected that the business will pick up in no time as the community is already appreciating the benefits of using solar energy instead of kerosene. Peter, the Chairman of the group (the first person standing on the left side) explains that so far the group members are the first beneficiaries of the lamps and they no longer buy kerosene.
His wife who has suffered using dim light for 2 years is now very happy and is also encouraging other women to buy the lamps. Peter and his family can now enjoy improved health with cleaner lighting and they also save the money that was previously used on buying kerosene. He has opened up an account and started saving the earnings from the sale of the solar lights which he says will be a financial security for his family.

loans.use: To buy solar lamps for sale

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is the age of 40, living in Lahore with her husband and three children. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He has grown old and his instruments are old, as well. His instruments need to be replaced with new ones. He wants to buy new instruments, but his financial condition does not allow him to buy new instruments. 

Due to his low purchasing power, Shehnaz requested a loan to empower her husband's purchasing power, so he could easily buy new instruments, such as scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror, and a revolving chair.

Shehnaz is growing old now and she does not have enough energy to manage her household activities. She wants to marry off her elder son, so that her daughter-in-law could hold all the household activities. 

Shehnaz hopes that this loan will work positively and she would be able to make some savings for household expenses. She says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scissors, combs, a shaving machine, a front mirror, and a revolving chair for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Ny (pictured here) sells fish that her husband catches. In addition, she is hired to farm and gets paid a fee. Her husband is a fisherman and a motor remorque taxi driver. Motor remorques (a motorbike with a long carriage at the back) are not legal in Phnom Penh. Therefore, Ny applied for a loan to buy a moto kangbei for her husband, which is allowed in Phnom Penh. About moto kangbei: in the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

loans.use: To buy a remoque kangbei [a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi] for her husband.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam is 31 years old, married, and has a daughter. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the city of Fuzuli in Azerbaijan, who now lives in the Fuzuli region  with his family. His wife is pregnant. She stays at home, while his daughter goes to preschool,.so he is the only one earning an income.

Islam opened his general store where he sells mostly home-use things. Now he needs a loan of 1,700 Azerbaijani manats (AZN) to repair and enlarge the store. In the future, he wants to sell food products, too, in his store as this will be more profitable for his business. Islam is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him.

loans.use: to repair and enlarge the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of clothing and fabric to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself as talkative. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle and he also farms to earn extra income. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are both men and women. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs so that he can invest in his farm. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks and food to sell.

loans.name: Jafali

texts.en: Jafali is a 48-year-old married man with 4 children living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He is a farmer who grows coffee and bananas.  He also works at a bus park as a company general manager and sells petrol on a small scale.  His dreams are to own a petrol station, educate his children up to the university level, and become a leading coffee supplier in the region despite inadequate capital.  Jafali intends to use the loan to buy liters of petrol to sell.

loans.use: to buy liters of petrol to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: As a married mother of five children, Marlene works hard to support her family.  She has a jeepney transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a coffee shop.  Marlene is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her jeepney.  Marlene has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can rent a space at a public market.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her jeepney.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 35 years old and lives in Logan Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well-known. She is unmarried and has two children who are 3 and 19 years old. They are presently in school and live at home. Patience is a ninth-grade dropout. For the past two years she has been running a table where she sells pampers, diapers, etc. She started this business with little money, which she saved over the years. She learned how to sell from her friends. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit and it keeps her busy. Patience is requesting a loan to buy more pampers and diapers for her business. Her plans are to build a house and to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more pampers, diapers, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 61-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is crop production alongside dairy farming. He faces challenges of changes in agricultural prices and unpredictable weather while his dream is to have a big farm and venture into mechanized agriculture.

Samuel intends to use the loan to pay workers who are digging his garden and to buy a heifer.

loans.use: to pay workers who are digging his garden and buy a heifer.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is 26. He is single and lives with his mother and brother. 

Amin opened his own teahouse, seven years ago. Amin had some obstacles at the beginning of his project because of the financial problems that he faced. He plans to expand his teahouse, to make it modern, with new equipment, dishes, and other  implements. His mother works as a cook in a restaurant and his brother is a waiter. 

Since last year, Amin has been repairing their house, yet there is still some work to be done to finish it completely. He is going to repair all the rooms of the house, including the bedroom, kitchen, and sitting room.
 
The loan, in the amount of AZN 1,600, is being taken to cover some missing building materials for repairing his family's house.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing his house.

loans.name: Constancita

texts.en:
Constancia earns a living from her food vending business. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. Constancia is in the business of selling home cooked snack foods to the people in her place. 

Constancia is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, milk and others. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, milk and others.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: Graciela, a sus 30 años es soltera y no tiene hijos. Debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales, ella decidió iniciar su propio negocio con el fin de generar los ingresos necesarios para solventar sus necesidades y gastos básicos. La actividad que realiza consiste en la venta de mercancía de marcas muy reconocidas de ropa, relojes, zapatos, perfumes, entre otros; estos productos se los ofrece a familiares, amigos y vecinos, además utiliza las herramientas tecnológicas con lo cual amplía su mercado, pues también los ofrece por redes sociales y páginas comerciales. La mercancía que comercializa muchas veces es traída del extranjero, pues ésta le puede generar un poco más de ganancias, sin embargo, también la compra en la ciudad donde reside. La cliente es una mujer activa, emprendedora, con proyección hacia el cumplimiento de sus objetivos; esto la motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (relojes, zapatos, camisetas, perfumería), pues aprovechará la oportunidad de comprarla en el extranjero, ya que una amiga tiene un viaje programado en los próximos días y se la enviará por encomienda. Así tendrá más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes y tener un mayor nivel de utilidades, incrementando sus ingresos. Graciela sueña con hacer crecer su negocio hasta convertirse en una gran distribuidora, para vender los productos en grandes almacenes y comerciantes de la ciudad; lo que le dará la posibilidad de tener mejores condiciones de vida y una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Graciela is 30 years old, is single, and has no children. Due to the lack of labor opportunities, she decided to begin her own business in order to generate the necessary income to meet her basic needs and expenses. The activity she does is selling merchandise of well-known brands of clothes, watches, shoes, perfumes, among other things. She offers these products to family members, friends, and neighbors. She uses technological tools for her business, including social networking and business pages. The merchandise she sells is often brought in from abroad, which allows her to generate a little more income. However, she also buys things in the city where she lives.

Graciela is a very active, entrepreneurial woman with a great projection toward the fulfillment of her objectives. This is the motive for her soliciting her first round of credit with the objective of buying more wholesale merchandise (watches, shoes, shirts, perfumes). She will buy it abroad, as her friend is taking a trip in the next few days, and she will send her back a package. She will have a greater variety of products to offer her clients, giver her a higher level of profits and increasing her income. 

Graciela dreams of growing her business to become a major distributer, selling her products to department stores and retailers in the city. This will give her the possibility of having better living conditions and a stable, favorable economic situation.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise (watches, shoes, shirts, perfume)

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 24 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cake (ice cake is the same as ice pop) in her community. She is applying for a loan to buy a deep freeze, cordial syrup, foam cups, sugar, a cooler and plastic bags. Margaret joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services. Margaret will use her profits to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy deep freezer, cordial syrup, foam cups, sugar, cooler and plastic bags.

loans.name: Ma.guadalupe

texts.en:
Ma.Guadalupe is a 45-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children; the oldest is 22 while the youngest is 8. She runs a RTW (ready to wear) business. She sells shorts, pants, T-shirts and blouses. Her husband is a construction worker. 

To help her husband meet the family's needs, she requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy various supplies like pants and shorts to cater to her customers' demand. In the future, Guadalupe would like to save a portion of her earnings to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy various clothing items for resale like pants and shorts

loans.name: Ranilo

texts.en:
Ranilo is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He has been in the farming business for more than seven years now. This is the source of his income.

Ranilo is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm. With this loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, thus augmenting his yield and income. 

In the future, Ranilo hopes to make his business a success and a sustainable source of income. In addition, he wants to save money for the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor cost of the farm.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad está acompañada y tiene tres hijos los cuales están en diferentes grados de educación en la primaria. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café. Ella aprendió dichas actividades en compañía de su pareja y de sus padres ya que ellos han sido desde toda una vida agricultores. Tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo brindado por sus padres. En la agricultura especialmente con el café es un producto delicado y de no tratarse a tiempo con los insumos necesario puede perderse la cosecha completa.
