Es por ello que ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el cual planea comprar 5 QQ de fertilizantes, 5 QQ de urea, 5 QQ de formula cafetalera y 5 litros de nutrí café con los cuales mantendrá segura y sana su cosecha para el periodo de corte.

Sus metas a largo plazo son las de ampliar sus cultivos de café con la compra de más tierra, sembrar una variedad de café más competitiva y tecnificar sus cultivos. Sus sueños es mediante a los ingresos darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, mejores oportunidades de estudio de las que ella tuvo en su juventud dando la oportunidad a sus hijos de enviarlos a la universidad para que sean personas de provecho.
texts.en:
María, 33, has a life partner and three children in elementary school. She has been growing coffee for 10 years. She learned this trade from her partner and his parents, who have farmed all their lives. She completed elementary school, thanks to her parents' support. 

Coffee is an especially sensitive crop, so the harvest can be lost if the plantings are not treated on schedule. So she has applied to COMIXMUL for a loan to buy 5 qq of fertilizer, 5 qq of urea, 5 qq of coffee formula, and 5 liters of nutricafé to protect the plants and ensure a good harvest when cutting time arrives. 

Her long-term goals are to buy more land to plant, to grow a more competitive variety of coffee, and to modernize her production. She dreams that this income will give her family a better standard of living and her children better educational opportunities than she had. She hopes that by sending her children to college, they will become accomplished people.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantings.

loans.name: Jess

texts.en:
Jess is a 30-year-old motorcycle driver from the town of CPG, Bohol. He has been in the business for several years now.  Jess is asking for a loan to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle. 

In the future, Jess has hopes of exploring another venture to augment his income.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to remodel the interior and exterior of her house.

loans.name: Laim

texts.en:
Laim is a 27-year-old married man living in a small village in Siem Reap Province. He is responsible for two members of his family, his spouse and a small child. He is a farmer and also works as a house construction laborer to have supplementary income. He has been in the construction industry since 2008 and earns $6.00 per day. 

At this time, Laim is having financial problems managing the funeral costs of his father. For this reason, he decided to acquire a loan of 1,000 USD from Kiva lenders to cover the funeral costs. He hopes that lenders will not reject his loan, and he promises to pay his loan back punctually, though it is his first loan.

loans.use: to cover the funeral costs of his father.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her current jewelry stock level

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his education fee.

loans.name: Roldano

texts.en:
Roldano is a 31-year-old, married man from Talibon, Bohol. He is the father of three children, ages 5, 4 and 1 year. He provides motorcycle transport services. He transports passengers from one barrio to another.

He requested a loan of 5000 PHP. He will use the loan amount to buy tires and maintenance, like changing the oil. This will enable him to continue serving his customers and earning income.

Roldano would like to manage well his livelihood activity, in order to support the basic needs of his family. At the same time, he could send his children to school using his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy tires and maintenance, like changing oil

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is taking out a loan to buy cosmetics such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She is a  30-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three children. Her husband is doing an ordinary job and earns very low income. 

Through the beauty salon she is taking an active part to increase the monthly income for her family. She is fully professional in her art; she provides makeover services to her clients at home. She is famous for bridal makeover; most of the ladies come from other towns for bridal makeover. With the passage of time her beauty products are going to be expended and right now she wants to buy more cosmetics products for her beauty salon. 

Therefore, Sumaira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she would be able to buy new cosmetic products such as facial cream, bleaching cream, nail polish, hair color, lotions etc.

She wants to establish a parlor in a nearby town because she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Sumaira feels proud when someone appreciates her art and her devotion to her family.  She says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics such as facial cream, face powder, lipstick, nail polish, etc. for beauty salon.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is a 47-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four grown children, and she engages in food vending. She sells homemade meals like fried fish, stewed vegetables, chicken, and pork menus. 

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy more supplies like rice, seasonings, fish, chicken, and vegetables to cater to the needs of her customers. 

In the future, Tomasita would like to expand her food vending business to improve her livelihood status and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like rice, seasonings, fish, chicken, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building a room in the front of his home.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevo Amanecer está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 7 de las mujeres están con ingresos muy bajos, pero con muchas ganas de capacitarse y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ramona, quien está trabajando para poder ayudar a su familia, y por medio de esos ingresos luchar por un mejor futuro para ellos.  Ella vende cosméticos, y por medio de su trabajo esta luchando y creciendo por salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, y de esa forma seguir con sus ventas y luchar por un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
The “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) group is taking the poverty elimination survey; seven of the women are very low income but with a strong desire to get training and to get ahead.

One of the members is Ramona who is working to be able to help her family and by means of this income strive for a better future for all of them.  She sells cosmetics, and through her work, she is striving to succeed.

She requests this loan to buy cosmetics to continue with her sales and striving for a better future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her education fee.

loans.name: Abdouratshidou

texts.fr:
Abdouratshidou est un jeune homme de 25 ans qui réside dans le quartier agoè. Il est scolarisé et a suivi une formation en comptabilité et en informatique.
Il vient de démarrer à domicile un commerce de vêtements et des pantalons Jeans et s’approvisionne au marché de Hédzranawoé deux fois par mois. Il souhaite étendre son activité au nord du TOGO notamment à Sokodé et Kara.
Il sollicite un crédit pour acheter 05 chemises LACOSTE, 10 manches longues et 7 pantalons Jeans.
Les revenus lui permettront d’améliorer sa condition de vie et ainsi d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires
texts.en:
Abdouratshidou is a young man of 25, living in the Agoè district. He has been enrolled in school and has done a program in accounting and computer science. 

He has just started up a home business selling clothing and jeans (pants) and he buys his wares in the market of  Hédzranawoé twice a month. He wishes to extend his business into the North of Togo, notably Sokodé et Kara.

He is asking for a loan to buy five Lacoste shirts, 10 long-sleeved shirts, and seven pairs of jeans (pants). The income will permit him to improve his living conditions and to grow his turnover.

loans.use: to buy 5 Lacoste shirts, 10 long-sleeved shirts, and 7 pairs of jeans.

loans.name: Hezel

texts.en: Hezel is  married, and has one child. She is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City, along with her family. To make a living, Hezel helps her husband to grow coconuts and bananas to sell and has been doing this for more than six years. She joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2012 and successfully repaid her previous loans with determination in order to augment their living.  Hezel is requesting a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to use for cultivation and fertilization of the farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cultivate and fertilize farmland.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is married, with four children. She is 50 years old and lives in Katipunan, Sinacaban.

Florentina sells lumber to earn a living and she has had this business for ten years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to pay for the repair of her multicab.

Florentina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for five years. In the future, she hopes to pay the school tuition fees and allowances for her children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of her multicab.

loans.name: Socias En Progreso  (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudadela San Cristóbal de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúnen  cada quince días las 11 socias y 1 socio  del Grupo De  Crédito Socias En Progreso. Las mismas que se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general, prestación de servicios entre otras actividades. Ellas hace tiempo atrás decidieron unirse  para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La  Fundación Espoir. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Jacqueline, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y el menor de 13 años, los dos mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en colegio. El marido trabaja en un centro comercial cuidando carros.

Doña Jacqueline  aprendió corte y confección hace varios años en una academia de la ciudad, ella tiene un taller de costura en su casa en el cual confecciona todo tipo de prendas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 21h00  o 22h00, dependiendo del trabajo que tenga que entregar, con ella trabaja una señora a quien le paga un sueldo mensual, ella  confecciona ropa a instituciones y colegios de la localidad pero también a personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller, lleva más de 20 años dedicada a esta actividad y lo que más le gusta hacer es ropa de niñas y de damas.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales útiles para elaborar sus prendas.  Esta desde el inicio en  el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los  créditos. 
Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos y tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 11 women and one man who are members of the communal bank "Grupo De Crédito Socias En Progreso" meet in San Cristóbal, Portoviejo. They are merchants and service providers who, a while back, decided to form a group to apply for the loans offered by Fundación Espoir. 

Jacqueline, 41, belongs to the group, is married, and has three children from the marriage. Her two older children are in college; her thirteen-year-old is in high school; and her husband works in an auto repair shop.

Jacqueline learned dressmaking in a local school some years ago and has a dressmaking shop in her house, where she makes all kinds of garments. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 9 or 10:00 p.m., depending on how much work her customers bring. She pays another woman a monthly salary, and they make local school and institutional uniforms and clothing for individuals. Jacqueline has been doing this work for more than 20 years, and she most enjoys making women's and girl's clothing.

This loan is to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other materials to make garments. She was one of the first members of the communal bank and welcomes the funding. She dreams of giving her children the best and of having a larger workshop.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Nalyn

texts.en:
Nalyn, a 42-year-old married mother of six children, four of whom are in school, works very hard to provide for them. For three years Nalyn has been running a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, detergent and other groceries. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

 
In the future, Nalyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rogelia

texts.en:
Rogelia is 59 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rogelia is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rogelia has been raising pigs for 20 years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Shandra

texts.en:
Shandra runs a small stall which sells toys, household appliances, and mobile phone airtime credits, and also offers a bill payment service. Shandra lives in Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Shandra is married.

Shandra began working with Ruma three months ago because he wanted to increase his income and business by selling mobile airtime and servicing bill payments. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has had around $30 - $35 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales).  

Recently, he took a loan from Kiva for getting a printer to support his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments (household electricity payments).

loans.use: to buy a printer to print out required receipts for mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Sarom's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Moung Russey District of Battambang Province, Sarom is a mother in early forties with three children. Her family relies on rice cropping on five hectares as the primary source of income. She has been involved with this business for 21 years, earning about 28,700 KHR per day. 

This is the second microloan for Sarom’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has fully repaid, has improved her living condition to a level better than before. 

Now, she and her fellow group member are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can produce a good yield which is better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Uriel Rodolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Uriel es originario de la cd. de Piedras Negras Coah, por situaciones economicas tuvo que irse a trabajar en Estados Unidos en donde estuvo viviendo 6 años, luego nuevamente regreso a Piedras Negras y acaba de cumplir 6 años viviendo aquí en esta cd., es casado y padre de dos hijos, él  y su esposa trabajan en una empresa reconocida en esta cd. la cual se dedica a la extracción de carbón.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para poder seguir ampliando su domicilio, que para esto construirá un nuevo cuarto en su vivienda y en un futuro aperturar un negocio de minisuper  y tener otro ingreso ya que menciona que desean mucho poder dejar algo de patrimonio para sus dos hijos y no se les haga dificil al momento de tener sus propias familias.
texts.en:
Uriel is from Piedras Negras, Coahuila. For financial reasons, he had to leave to work in the United States for six years. He returned to Piedras Negras, where he has been living for six years. He is married and has two sons. He and his wife work for a well-known, local, coal-mining company. 

He has applied to Kiva for funding to build a new room for his house. He would also like to open a mini-market to have additional income. He wants to be able to leave his two children an inheritance some day so that they can support their own families.

loans.use: to build another room in his house.

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean is 44 years old and the mother of an adult son. She lives with her family in a remote area of Siem Reap province. She owns and operates a rice farm on a few pieces of land to generate a livelihood. Her husband and son help her in managing their farm during the rainy season and also work in the construction industry for additional income. Having been in this business for years, Ean’s husband is now a construction master so he can earn more than normal laborers.

Ean wants to receive a loan of $300 to build a latrine. This will increase the value of her family and promote their health because currently there is no bathroom in the house. More importantly, the family will release less pollutants and contribute to the efforts against air pollution in the surrounding areas. She expresses her thanks to all kind lenders.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Unidos Group

texts.es:
El grupo conformado por 5 jóvenes está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de jóvenes, donde todos tienen iniciativa de  trabajar y se ayudan por salir adelante. Tienen deseos de trabajar en equipo con el fundamento de lograr ayudarse con responsabilidad para mejorar el nivel de vida de cada uno de ellos. Saben que con  trabajo  esfuerzo  continuo y permanente podrán lograr sus objetivos propuestos  con la ayuda y oportunidad brindada por Fundación Paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es Ana, quien hace bijouterie para poder vender, tener un poco de ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar un poco con los gastos de la casa. Es una joven con muchos ideales.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos, pinzas canutillos y demás artículos para poder seguir haciendo su bijouterie para la venta.
texts.en:
This group of five young people are seeking their first loan. They are all keen to work and help each other move forward. They wish to work as a team with the goal of mutual assistance and responsibility to improve each person's quality of life. They know that with work and constant effort they will be able to achieve their proposed goals with help from Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members of the group is Ana who makes and sells jewelry to earn a little money and help with household expenses. She is an idealistic young woman. She is seeking a loan to buy thread, special pliers and other items so she can continue with her jewelry business.

loans.use: Buy thread, special pliers and other items

loans.name: Lolajon

texts.ru: Лолачон 63-летняя вдова, имеющая четверых детей. Недавно она потеряла мужа, с которым жила бок о бок почти 40 лет. Ей было трудно, но она смирилась с потерей, так как у нее есть дети и внуки ради которых она должна жить, а также работа, которую необходимо продолжить. Лолачон в течение 20 лет работает Депутатом джамоата Исоева района Дж.Руми. Жители ее села уважают ее за честность и справедливость. Все ее дети уже взрослые и самостоятельно зарабатывают. Лолачон хочет заполнить свою жизнь и не предаваться грусти. Поэтому она решилась начать свой бизнес, "Откорм-продажа скота". Она собирается выращивать крупнорогатый скот. У нее есть коровник во дворе дома и немного корма. Лолачон просит кредит в размере 2000 долларов США для своего дела. Она хочет закупить коров и телят и начать деятельность.
texts.en:
Lolajon is a 63-year-old widow with four children. Not long ago she lost her husband, with whom she had lived side by side for almost 40 years. It was difficult for her, but she came to terms with it, as she has children and grandchildren she needs to live for, as well as work that she has to continue.

For 20 years, Lolajon has been working as Delegate of the Isoyev division of the J. Rumy region. The residents of her village respect her for her honesty and fairness. All of her children are adults now and support themselves. Lolajon wants to fill up her life and not give in to sadness. Therefore she has decided to start her own business, "Fatten and Sell Cattle". She intends to breed big-horned cattle. She has a cow shed in the her yard and some feed. Lolajon is asking for a loan of US$2,000 for her business. She wants to buy cows and calves and start working.

loans.use: to buy cows and calves in order to start a business

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Rosa Mística  están en su ciclo número 2 del programa comité de mujeres, donde todas tienen actividades productivas y donde todas se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y unidas están superaron la línea de pobreza.
Teresa es una de las integrantes, quien se dedica al crochet, y también al tejido del ñanduti, el cual es un tejido típico del Paraguay. Ella es una persona que se está esforzando por mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de hilos, agujas, telas y demás, para poder seguir con sus confecciones.
texts.en:
The group named “Rosa Mística” is in its second loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program.  All of the members have productive business activities and help one another move forward.  The members have taken a poverty elimination survey and together they have surpassed the poverty line.    

Teresa is one of the members who engages in crochet and making “ñanduti”, which is a traditional embroidered lace from Paraguay.  She is a person who is striving to improve her living conditions and those of her family.  Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of thread, needles, fabric, and other supplies so that she can continue producing her creations.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, fabric, and other supplies.

loans.name: Asmabeth

texts.en:
Asmabeth is married with 2 children. Asmabeth is 47 years old and lives in Tangub, Philippines.

Asmabeth is a fishpond operator to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fingerlings and feed for the feedings. 

Asmabeth has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Asmabeth hopes to expand her fishpond area someday.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings and feed
